title: Virtual Assistant – Inbound & Outbound Sales / Customer Service (Long-Term Career Role)  Company: Refresh Cleaning Plus
description:
Refresh Cleaning Plus is a fast-growing home and commercial cleaning services company in the United States. We are looking for a professional, reliable, and motivated Virtual Assistant to join our team long-term.







This is a very important role in our company. You will handle both inbound and outbound calls, book jobs, speak with customers, provide pricing, and help grow our business through excellent customer service and sales.







We are looking for someone who wants a stable, long-term position and a career with a growing company.



Responsibilities:



Answer inbound calls from customers and provide excellent customer service



Make outbound calls to leads and past customers to book jobs and follow up on estimates



Provide pricing and explain all of our services clearly:



Window Cleaning



Pressure Washing



Gutter Cleaning



Junk Removal



Janitorial / Office Cleaning



Book jobs and schedule appointments accurately



Collect payments and process customer information



Follow scripts and procedures (we will train you)



Update customer records and notes in our system



Requirements:



Excellent spoken and written English (neutral accent preferred)



Confident speaking on the phone with American customers



Sales experience strongly preferred (inbound and outbound)



Friendly, professional, and positive attitude



Extremely reliable and on time every day



Organized and detail-oriented



Strong internet connection, quiet workspace, and good headset



Willing to learn and improve continuously



Pay & Growth:



Starting pay: $4.00 per hour + Bonuses



Raise of $0.25 every 6 months based on performance



Maximum pay: $7.00 per hour



Full-time position



Long-term career opportunity with growth as the company expands





We are not looking for short-term freelancers. We are building a team and want someone who wants stability, growth, and a future with our company.







We value loyalty, hard work, and great performance. Top performers will have opportunities for increased responsibility and future promotions.



To Apply:



Please send:



A short introduction about yourself



Your experience with inbound and outbound calls / sales



Your internet speed and equipment details



A short voice recording in English (required)

title: Outbound Sales/ Appointment Setter (US Cleaning Industry)
description:
We are a U.S.-based company that provides cleaning and facility services (commercial cleaning, janitorial, window cleaning). We are looking for a reliable, confident Outbound Sales / Appointment Setter to help us contact U.S. businesses and book walkthroughs or discovery calls.







This role is NOT cold selling. Your main job is to:



Call or message businesses



Introduce our services clearly



Qualify interest



Schedule appointments







If you speak clear English, follow scripts well, and are comfortable talking to U.S. businesses, this role is for you.



Responsibilities



Make outbound calls to U.S. businesses (provided lists)



Follow a simple call script



Qualify prospects (size, location, cleaning needs)



Schedule walkthroughs or calls on our calendar



Update notes in our CRM



Be polite, professional, and confident on the phone



Requirements



Fluent English (neutral accent preferred)



Comfortable speaking on the phone with U.S. businesses



Previous outbound calling, appointment setting, or sales experience preferred



Reliable internet and quiet workspace



Organized and coachable



Willing to improve and take feedback



Work Schedule



Part-time or full-time



U.S. business hours (EST or CST)



Monday–Friday



Pay



$3$-$5 USD per hour + Commission for booked appointments 



Performance bonuses available for booked appointments



Long-term position for the right candidate



Why Work With Us



Stable, long-term work



Clear scripts and training provided



Supportive management



Opportunity to grow into a higher-paying role

title: High IQ Data Sourcer
description:
We are seeking an extremely motivated, determined, and creative Virtual Assistant. The primary responsibility will be to source profitable products that meet our specific criteria. You will receive comprehensive training to ensure you are well-equipped to perform the tasks effectively. We would like you to start as part-time, with an opportunity to grow into fulltime as the business grows.



We want someone long-term & with good english.



Responsibilities include:

• Researching and identifying potential products for online arbitrage.

• Analyzing product profitability and demand.

• Maintaining accurate records of product research and findings.

• Communicating regularly with the team to ensure alignment with business goals.



You will use tools such as Keepa and SellerAMP to reverse source the stores of other sellers on Amazon. You will find which products they are selling that are profitable, and place them on a Google Sheet with detailed information such as cost price, sales per month, and sourcing location.



We have extensive training videos prepared and a lead Virtual Assistant available to answer questions at any time.



IMPORTANT: Make the subject line of your application a math equation that equals 32 when solved.

title: Video Editor for eCommerce ads (Adobe Premiere Pro)
description:
Apply by sending us a message with your portfolio.



About Us

We’re a fast-growing e-commerce brand investing heavily in video advertising. Our creative team is strong, but as we scale, we need more high-performing ad creatives — and that’s where you come in.

If you love editing videos that grab attention and drive results, we’d like to hear from you.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a creative, detail-oriented Video Editor to join our remote team. You’ll work closely with our creative strategists to produce scroll-stopping video ads for Meta and Snapchat that connect emotionally and convert viewers into customers.



Your Responsibilities

- Edit raw footage into engaging, high-converting video ads

- Create multiple variations for A/B testing (hooks, angles, CTAs, etc.)

- Add music, sound effects, pacing, and transitions to enhance performance

- Maintain strong brand consistency and creative quality across all assets

- Stay updated on social media trends, formats, and ad styles



Requirements

- Proven video editing experience (portfolio required)

- Strong proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro

- Understanding of short-form paid social content is a plus



You Are

- Creative and proactive

- Independent and reliable

- Detail-oriented with high standards

- Accountable and deadline-driven



What We Offer

- Fixed salary: $1,000/month

- Long-term remote position

- Collaborative environment with experienced video editors

- Opportunity to grow with a fast-scaling e-commerce brand



What We Expect

- Full-time commitment (40 hours/week, Monday–Friday)

- Delivery equivalent to 10–20 minutes of edited video per week



Interested?

Send us a message with your portfolio and a short introduction.

title: Account Manager
description:
Benefits:



Work From Home

Guaranteed $500 USD per week

Additional available if you perform well

Unlimited potential through residual because you earn as long as your customers stay with Fleetsmarts



What we do as a company:



We give a fuel card away for free to truckers in the US that have discounts on diesel fuel. We have add-on products that make the sale more attractive to the customer. Customers can get weekly credit lines for their fuel card if they use our factoring service, which is asking to a pay-day loan service for businesses, but we provide this service for free. We also have a service to help reduce the down payment on their insurance. We market to new trucking companies that are just starting out and all our products are designed to help them get going faster than they would be able to on their own.



What you do:

You call warm appointments for truckers who have already expressed interest

You explain how we can help them

95% of people say yes

The key is following up until they actually start using our services





Key Responsibilities:

Proactively follow up on abandoned or inactive leads assigned to account managers.

Present and promote fuel card programs, factoring services, and insurance solutions to potential clients.

Assist customers with the activation of fuel cards and ensure a preferred payment method is added.

Offer factoring services and guide customers through the contract signing process to ensure completion and compliance



Qualifications:

Proven experience in sales, customer retention, or outbound calling (required)

Strong communication and negotiation skills

Confident handling high-volume outbound calls

Goal-oriented, persistent, and able to work independently

Organized and comfortable using CRM tools and office software

Positive attitude and ability to build rapport quickly.

title: Real Estate Closing/Listing Coordinator
description:
THIS IS A FULL-TIME OPPORTUNITY AND WE DO NOT ALLOW OUR VIRTUAL PROFESSIONALS TO HAVE OTHER ONGOING VA-TYPE JOBS WHILE WORKING FOR US. Cain Realty Group is seeking to grow its Success Team by hiring an additional Administrative Assistant to serve both our home-buying and home-selling clients. There is a clear path to growth and the opportunities that could come from this role are limitless. For the Administrative Assistant role, we are only considering applicants with residential real estate experience in some capacity.



The perfect candidate for this role is a Virtual Professional that has worked as a transaction coordinator and/or a listing coordinator for another Realtor or real estate team in Texas, preferably with Keller Williams. We will consider those that have worked in this capacity for Realtors in other states, yet it would be helpful to have someone with knowledge of Texas documents. WE WILL ONLY INTERVIEW THOSE WITH RESIDENTIAL REAL ESTATE EXPERIENCE OF AT LEAST ONE YEAR.



Health Insurance is also provided through reimbursement after six months, and annual performance reviews are conducted to determine whether or not a raise has been earned. We take care of our people and are looking for long-terms Virtual Professionals.



We'd also like you to know that CRG has successfully worked with Virtual Professionals for over 6 years now. We have proven systems and models to ensure success for our VPs. We are not a company hoping to make a VP work or trying an experiment. We have a proven track record of helping our VPs become extremely successful. We are looking for long-term fits and only looking for those wanting to have CRG as their sole employer in a full-time capacity.



We will conduct reference checks, and WE WILL REQUIRE REFERENCES IN THE FORM OF A PHONE NUMBER SO THAT WE CAN SPEAK TO YOUR PRIOR EMPLOYERS. We want to ensure we are bringing on the best of the best, so we will not accept candidates only willing to provide
 addresses as a reference. WE ALSO REQUIRE A CURRENT COPY OF A VALID NBI PRIOR TO THE START DATE.



This position requires a well-organized, service-minded individual with good time-management skills and attention to detail. This person will provide administrative support to our Account Managers, which then frees them up to consistently communicate with our clients. This is a very tech-savvy position, so strong technology aptitude is a must to complete tasks. We use Sierra Interactive as our CRM and Sisu for task management.



A few of our group's most commonly used affirmations and mottos are below:

-Get comfortable being uncomfortable

-The only way to grow is to change

-Keep your emotions between the lines

-BE DO HAVE



Primary Objectives

-Maintain and manage all systems for sellers, buyers, database management, information management, and back-office support

-Manage contracts alongside the Account Manager through closing

-Manage listings alongside the Account Manager through the contract

-Keep the Agents and Account Managers informed regarding any problems or issues that need to be handled

-Assist the Director of Operations with blog writing and social media posting



Regular Work Activities

-System development, implementation, and management

-Information management

-Oversight of contracts and listings

-Regular, effective communication with Agents and Account Managers

-Coordinate various pre-listing activities for our home selling clients



Key Skills

-Transaction and Listing Coordination

-Strong written communication skills

-Exceptional organizational and project management abilities

-Great ability to focus

-Concerned about doing things the right way

-Calm under pressure

-Learning-based

-Service-based attitude

-Proven ability to succeed



Systems Used

-Docusign

-KW Command

-ZipForms

-Matrix MLS

-Gsuite

-Sierra Interactive

-Sisu

-Canva

-Mailchimp



People Contacts and Interactions

-Client Experience Managers – daily

-Lead Administrative Assistant– daily

-Agents – as appropriate



Work Schedule (5 days / week)

- M-F, 9 AM to 6 PM CST

- Rotating Sat shifts (11 AM to 4 PM CST) every three weeks with a Wed off that week (paid for a full 8-hour shift)



System Requirements

-Internet connection with at least 10mbps speed

-Reliable backup internet connection

-Reliable power backup



Learn More About Us!


/hiring

title: Website Designer
description:
Web Designer [Figma Experience Essential]



Location: Remote (Must be available for a minimum of 2-3 hours during UK hours for communication/calls)

Type: Full-time (Following a short initial trial period)

Pay: $8/hour on trial basis, with rates increasing accordingly based on skill & capabilities.



We’re on the hunt for a talented Website Designer to join our small team and contribute to websites that are not only beautiful but conversion-focused and easy to manage for our clients.



As a tight-knit team, we work closely and collaboratively, so we're looking for someone who is not only technically skilled but also proactive, communicative and genuinely cares about doing great work.



What you’ll do:



- Drive the design process from initial concepts to final mockups

- Create user-friendly websites that are on brand, visual and high-converting

- Complete design research, wireframing and creative exploration on every project

- Consult on design strategy to ensure UI/UX is tailored to specific company requirements

- Using Relume for efficient site structuring and scalable component libraries.

- Collaborate with our team via Slack,
, and regular video calls to align on goals and client feedback.

- Designing pixel-perfect, mobile-optimised websites and handing over to our developers

- Iterate on designs based on feedback from internal reviews and client input



We’re looking for:



- 3+ year experience

- Must be proficient in Figma (with a strong grasp of auto-layout, components and responsiveness)

- Strong attention to detail and a clear understanding of what makes websites not just pretty, but conversion-focused.

- Solid communication skills in fluent English; we value open discussion and feedback.

- Experience in motion design, animation & illustration is an added advantage



Each application must contain the following:



- 10 AP points

- Short intro to yourself and why you’d be a good fit for us

- A link to a recent project in Figma



BONUS: A 20 second loom video introducing yourself & your experience



Those who do not meet the criteria above, will not be considered.

title: Media Director (YouTube Producer / Channel Manager) | Extramilest (111k subs)
description:
About the Job



Extramilest LLC is hiring a Media Director (YouTube Producer / Channel Manager) to run the entire content and distribution engine for The Extramilest Show (111k subs) and the broader Extramilest platform.



You will take a raw Dropbox folder and turn it into a consistent weekly release, then distribute it across every channel with strong copy in Floris’s voice. Floris handles the interviews. You run everything after that.



Weekly output targets

> 1 full YouTube episode (60–90 minutes)

> 2–3 segment clips (6–10 minutes)

> 3–5 short-form clips (15–60 seconds)



Core responsibility

Own the full content pipeline and calendar so we are scheduled ahead (2–4+ weeks) and not operating in last-minute chaos.



Schedule: Must start at 5:00 AM Pacific Time and maintain consistent US timezone overlap.



Key Responsibilities (A to Z):



1. Master Content Calendar (All Channels)

Own and manage the content calendar and publishing schedule across: YouTube, podcast, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, newsletter, blog, Substack,
 group, Strava, and Skool. You make sure every week is planned, organized, and executed on time.



2. Weekly YouTube + Podcast Production (A to Z)



- Oversee each episode from raw Dropbox files to final publish

- Plan the edit structure: strong opening hook, pacing, b-roll/guest assets, sponsor integrations, outro

- Manage publishing details: titles, descriptions, chapters, tags, pinned comments, end screens

- Ensure podcast version is packaged correctly (title, description, sponsor mentions, show notes, uploads)



3. Repurposing Engine: New Episodes + Back Catalog

This role is not only about weekly episodes. It’s also about turning our archive into a growth machine.

Use transcripts + AI tools + editorial judgment to identify the best 
nts



- Oversee segments and short-form clips (Reels/Shorts/TikTok) from each new episode

- Build a structured pipeline to repurpose older episodes into fresh short-form and segment clips

- Organize themes, playlists, “best of” collections, and evergreen topic series from past content



4. Lead the Production Team

- Manage 2 video editors, a thumbnail designer, and coordinate with a VA

- Create clear briefs, deadlines, review cycles, feedback loops, and quality control

- Ensure every deliverable hits the quality bar and is on schedule



5. Copywriting and Voice (Required)

You will write or direct all copy in Floris’s voice, including:



- YouTube titles, descriptions, chapters, pinned comments

- Social captions and post copy for IG, TikTok, LinkedIn,
, Strava, and Skool

- Newsletter drafts + subject lines

- Blog post intros/summaries and show notes

- AI can be used for speed, but the final must feel human, grounded, and on-brand.



6. Community and Distribution Support



- Coordinate distribution across platforms so each episode becomes a full multi-platform campaign

- Support community growth by turning episode insights into posts for Skool, Strava, and

- Work with the VA to finalize timestamps, links, show notes, blog formatting, and scheduling



7. Guest + Sponsor Coordination



- Help coordinate guest scheduling and logistics

- Create concise guest research briefs for Floris

- Coordinate sponsor communication and ensure deliverables are executed correctly (talking points, links, timestamps, approvals if needed)



Ideal Candidate

You are a true “quarterback” who can run a content machine without being micromanaged.



- You’ve managed YouTube and/or podcast operations end-to-end and can show results

- You understand performance drivers: hooks, retention, titles, thumbnails, CTR

- You can lead creatives, give clear feedback, and ship consistently every week

- You’re an excellent English writer and can match someone else’s voice

- You are extremely organized, proactive, and calm under pressure

- You care about health/fitness/performance and want to build positive, high-integrity content



Job Requirements



- Proven experience as a YouTube Producer, Channel Manager, Content Lead, or Podcast Producer (portfolio links required)

- Strong English (written + spoken)

- Team leadership experience (editors + designer + assistant)

- Strong workflow management: Dropbox, transcripts, clip selection, publishing

- Comfortable using AI + transcript tools to move faster (without sounding generic)

- Reliable 5:00 AM PT start time and consistent US timezone overlap





Compensation

USD $1,800 to $2,500 per month (based on experience and proven results)





Other compensation

- Performance bonus tied to consistency and execution (on-time weekly publishing, output volume, quality standards, key growth milestones)

- Paid time off: 10 days PTO plus PH public holidays

- Annual compensation review based on performance and expanded responsibilities





To apply

- When applying for this job, write #8698 at the top of your application and include:

- What experience do you have in this field? Share 2–3 specific examples with links and results.

- Why should we hire you over other candidates? Be specific about what you will do better.



Walk through your process to turn one 75-minute raw interview into:

> 1 full YouTube episode

> 2–3 segment clips

> 3–5 short-form clips



- What tools and AI workflows do you use for transcripts, clip selection, calendars, and writing copy?

- What are your working hours in Philippine time, and can you reliably start at 5:00 AM Pacific Time every workday?

- Why does the Extramilest mission resonate with you personally?



Include your expected monthly rate.

title: NOC engineer
description:
About PCSN:

At PCSN, we pride ourselves on building innovative IT solutions that deliver true business value. We are not your average MSP — we combine deep technical skill with relentless follow-through and a culture of execution. Our team thrives on creative problem solving, accountability, and a drive to build something bigger than ourselves.



Role Overview:

We’re looking for a detail-driven and process-oriented Centralized Services Engineer to take ownership of our core monitoring and remediation workflows. You’ll play a key role in maintaining, improving, and automating proactive services for our client base through tools like Kaseya VSA, Autotask, and IT Glue.



Your superpower? Follow-through. We can teach you new tools, but we can’t teach relentless ownership — that part must already live in you.



Key Responsibilities:

Configure and manage monitoring policies, alerts, and scripts in Kaseya VSA to ensure proactive issue detection and resolution.

Create and schedule batch jobs and scripts for automated remediation and maintenance.

Modify existing alerts and deploy new monitors as client needs evolve.

Develop and troubleshoot remediation scripts using Windows command line and PowerShell.

Partner with the Helpdesk and NOC teams to close the loop on escalated alerts and tickets.

Keep documentation in IT Glue updated as systems and procedures evolve.

Use Autotask to manage alerts, ticket queues, and ensure SLAs are met.

Own follow-up tasks and ensure all assigned actions are driven through to completion.



What Makes You a Fit:

Must-Have Skills & Traits:

Proficiency with Kaseya VSA: You’ve built and maintained alerts, scripts, and automations.

Command line & scripting: Familiarity with Windows CLI; basic to intermediate PowerShell.

Process ownership: You follow up, close loops, and don’t let things slip.

Responsiveness: When something breaks or changes, you’re on it — fast.

Documentation-minded: You leave no trail behind — everything is documented and replicable.



Nice-to-Have Experience:

Prior experience using Autotask PSA.

Comfort with IT Glue or similar documentation systems.

Exposure to broader RMM concepts or tools beyond Kaseya.

Prior experience in a Centralized Services, NOC, or Proactive Services role at an MSP.



What Success Looks Like:

You’ve reduced noise by refining alert thresholds and eliminating false positives.

You’ve delivered repeatable automation that saves the team hours weekly.

Tickets related to recurring problems are disappearing thanks to your batch jobs and scripts.

Colleagues trust that when you take something on, it will get done — every time.



Why Join Us?

Be part of a forward-thinking MSP that encourages creativity and innovation.

Work with a supportive, sharp, and ambitious team.

Enjoy flexible work arrangements and a results-driven culture.

Grow your career with coaching, tools, and real ownership.

title: Remote VA Receptionist (Immediate Hire | 24-Hour Review)
description:
We are hiring a Remote Spa Receptionist for immediate placement. This role primarily handles inbound calls and appointment booking, but also includes additional administrative and operational tasks beyond call handling as assigned. Applications are reviewed within 24 hours for serious candidates, and this position requires immediate availability. All calls are recorded and monitored. Performance is strictly evaluated based on booking success, accuracy, professional phone presence, low drop-call rate, and adherence to scripts and procedures. This is a long-term role for candidates who can consistently meet expectations.

Note: We value authentic responses—please avoid overly generic or AI-generated answers.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected? 



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed. 



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute? 



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome. 



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional. 



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job? 



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired? 



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available. 



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Digital Marketing Assistant - SEO
description:
Digital Marketing & Web Assistant - WordPress/Elementor/AI (Remote, Philippines)

About Eden Digital

We're a boutique digital marketing agency based in Arizona specializing in healthcare and home service businesses. Our clients include mental health treatment centers, HVAC companies, roofing contractors, and specialty service providers. We create authentic, strategic marketing that actually ranks—no generic AI slop allowed.

The Role

We're looking for a creative, tech-savvy assistant to help bring web designs to life and support our growing client base. You'll work directly with the founder, using AI tools like Claude and ChatGPT to develop custom widgets, build out page designs in Elementor, and keep projects moving forward.

This is a beginning position with real growth potential. We're a small agency with big plans, and the right person will have the opportunity to take on more responsibility, develop advanced skills, and build this into a long-term career—not just a job.

What You'll Do



Build and implement custom widgets and interactive elements using AI-assisted development

Design and update pages in WordPress/Elementor based on provided direction

Source and select high-quality stock photos that fit each client's brand and audience

Use Claude AI and ChatGPT as daily working tools for content, code, and problem-solving

Help manage projects—tracking tasks, deadlines, and client deliverables

Support local SEO efforts including Google Business Profile updates and on-page optimization

Communicate progress and flag issues before they become problems



Nice to have



Have hands-on experience with WordPress and Elementor (this is non-negotiable)

Have experience with Notion or similar project management system

Already use Claude AI and/or ChatGPT comfortably—you get how to prompt effectively

Have a natural eye for visuals and can spot the difference between a good stock photo and a cheesy one

Are organized and can juggle multiple client projects without dropping balls

Have strong written English and clear communication skills

Know local SEO basics OR are genuinely eager to learn (we'll train the right person)

Are reliable, self-motivated, and don't need constant hand-holding

Have stable internet and a quiet workspace

title: Custom Apparel Graphic Designer

?

?

?

 • Structured, organized, disciplined

 • No excuses

?



What We Offer

title: Technical Writer (Bilingual Spanish)
description:
Description

The Technical Writer will develop and maintain safety-focused documentation that supports our clients and internal stakeholders. This role will be instrumental in writing, editing, and refreshing materials such as safety manuals, documentation, and compliance content. The ideal candidate thrives on accountability, consistently meets deadlines, and contributes to clear and compliant safety communications.



Key Responsibilities:

- Write, edit, and format safety manuals, policies, procedures, and guidance documents.

- Refresh and revise existing documents to ensure accuracy and compliance with current OSHA/HSE standards.

- Draft materials for construction site safety meetings and toolbox talks.

- Prepare clear, concise summaries and follow-ups from safety meetings and client engagements.

- Incorporate regulatory requirements and best practices into content by researching OSHA and industry standards.

- Ensure all documents are delivered with exceptional attention to detail, accurate technical information, consistent terminology, and proper formatting.

- Collaborate with subject-matter experts to validate technical content.

- Prioritize and manage multiple projects concurrently while meeting deadlines.

- Track deliverables to ensure timely completion with minimal revision cycles.



Requirements

- Proven experience as a Technical Writer, preferably with safety, compliance, or industrial content.

- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

- strong attention to detail and ability to produce error-free documentation.

- High level of accountability and demonstrated ability to reliably meet deadlines.

- Comfortable multitasking and managing shifting priorities.



Preferred

- Bilingual in Spanish and English

- OSHA 30-Hour Training Certification or equivalent safety training experience.

- Experience writing safety manuals, compliance documentation, or construction-focused materials.

- Familiarity with contractor compliance platforms and requirements.

- Experience working with subject matter experts and translating technical language into clear, user-friendly content.



Minimum Technical and Work Environment Requirements:



Internet Connection:

Primary internet connection with a minimum speed of 15 Mbps.

Backup internet connection with at least 10 Mbps.

Backup connection must be capable of supporting work during a power outage.

Primary Device:

Desktop or laptop equipped with at least:

Intel Core i5 (8th generation or newer), Intel Core i3 (10th generation or newer), AMD Ryzen 5, or an equivalent processor.

A minimum of 8 GB RAM.

Backup Device:

Must meet or exceed the performance of an Intel Core i3 processor.

Must be functional during power interruptions.

A functioning webcam.

A noise-canceling USB headset.

A quiet, dedicated home office space.

Peripherals and Workspace: A smartphone for communication and verification purposes.

title: Medical Billing Specialist - Claims Follow up Specialist
description:
We are looking for a full-time, highly detailed, accurate, and motivated Medical Billing Specialist to help the company in our claims resolution department whose main focus is on resolving outstanding insurance claims to ensure maximum payer reimbursement for clients.



The ideal candidate for this position is extremely organized, highly attentive to detail, professional, takes initiative, and values the importance of efficiencies. S/he should be comfortable with technology systems, and needs to be able to speak / read / write & understand American English.



Required Skills and Duties:



The Medical Billing Specialist should have skills for and experience in office practices and procedures in U.S. Healthcare. Proficiency in computer use and data entry is essential. Computer experience, including, but not limited to: word processing and spreadsheet applications, with minimum of 40wpm typing speed and 10-key by touch. S/he must also be able to work well with people, maintain confidentiality, and communicate effectively.



Furthermore, skills and knowledge required include:



Experience in CPT, ICD-10, and Medical Terminology.

Familiarity with EOB's, data entry, and working with insurance companies.

Critical thinking skills – utilizes available resources, seeks answers prior to asking for assistance, analyzes situations, and is capable of making decisions.

Knowledge of Microsoft products, Google Platform and Medical Billing software required. *experience with EHRs are a plus.

Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, projects, and demands successfully.

Can work independently, research and resolve issues, not afraid to answer questions using tools provided.

Close attention to detail, high accuracy, and stellar organizational skills are a must.

Desire to be part of a performance driven team taking responsibility for obtaining goals as set by management.

Maintain extreme confidentiality at all times to include, but not limited to patient, client, and colleague information.

Must be extremely detail oriented

Excellent customer service skills

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work well within a team as well as individually

Responsible use of confidential information

Perform to company standards of compliance with policies and procedures

Experience researching and relaying knowledge effectively is a plus



Functions and Duties of the role may include some or all of:



Take appropriate follow-up action on underpaid, no response, and denied claims.

Review account registration, charge entry, coding, payments and contractual adjustments posted, and account/claim history following steps to swiftly and efficiently resolve.

Research and effectively communicate payer trends and issues.

Research and resolve payer rejects and denials with a goal to prevent in the future.

Document actions in an accurate and concise manner.

Communicate effectively and professionally with insurance representatives, internal tea
mbers, and providers.

Identify, research, and resolve credit balances.

Other duties as assigned.



Required Experience

Education – high school diploma or GED equivalent. College degree preferred.

Experience – two (2) years in revenue cycle - insurance resolution (claims follow up) highly preferred.

title: Real Estate Closing/Listing Coordinator
description:
Cain Realty Group (CRG) is growing our Success Team and is seeking a full-time Administrative Assistant to support both our home-buying and home-selling clients. This role is critical to our operations and offers a clear path for growth within a well-established, high-performing real estate team.



Important: This is a full-time position, and Virtual Professionals may not hold any other VA-type roles while employed with CRG. We are looking for long-term tea
mbers who want CRG to be their sole employer.



Who We’re Looking For:

We are only considering candidates with at least one (1) year of residential real estate experience.

The ideal candidate is a Virtual Professional who has worked as a Transaction Coordinator/Listing Coordinator for a Realtor or real estate team, preferably in Texas and ideally with Keller Williams. Experience with Realtors in other states will be considered; however, familiarity with Texas real estate documents is a strong plus.



*Applicants without residential real estate experience will not be considered or interviewed.



Why Work With Cain Realty Group?

Full-time, long-term opportunity

Clear growth potential within the company

Health insurance reimbursement after 6 months

Annual performance reviews with raise eligibility

Proven systems, models, and training

CRG has successfully worked with Virtual Professionals for over 6 years. We are not experimenting—we have a proven track record of helping our VPs thrive and build stable, long-term careers.



Role Overview:

This position requires a highly organized, service-oriented professional with excellent time-management skills and strong attention to detail. You will provide administrative support to our Account Managers, allowing them to focus on consistent, high-quality communication with clients. This is a tech-forward role, so strong technical aptitude is essential.



Requirements & Screening

To maintain the highest standards, the following are required:

Minimum of 1 year residential real estate experience

Professional references with phone numbers

(We will speak directly with prior employers;
-only references will not be accepted.)

Current, valid NBI clearance prior to start date



If you are an experienced real estate Virtual Professional seeking a stable, full-time role with a team that truly invests in its people, we encourage you to apply.



A few of our group's most commonly used affirmations and mottos are below:

-Get comfortable being uncomfortable

-The only way to grow is to change

-Keep your emotions between the lines

-BE DO HAVE



Primary Objectives

-Maintain and manage all systems for sellers, buyers, database management, information management, and back-office support

-Manage contracts alongside the Account Manager through closing

-Manage listings alongside the Account Manager through the contract

-Keep the Agents and Account Managers informed regarding any problems or issues that need to be handled

-Assist the Director of Operations with blog writing and social media posting



Regular Work Activities

-System development, implementation, and management

-Information management

-Oversight of contracts and listings

-Regular, effective communication with Agents and Account Managers

-Coordinate various pre-listing activities for our home selling clients



Key Skills

-Transaction and Listing Coordination

-Strong written communication skills

-Exceptional organizational and project management abilities

-Great ability to focus

-Concerned about doing things the right way

-Calm under pressure

-Learning-based

-Service-based attitude

-Proven ability to succeed



Systems Used

-Docusign

-KW Command

-ZipForms

-Matrix MLS

-Gsuite

-Sierra Interactive

-Sisu

-Canva

-Mailchimp



People Contacts and Interactions

-Lead Administrative Assistant– daily

-Agents – as appropriate



Work Schedule (5 days / week)

- M-F, 9 AM to 6 PM CST

- Rotating Sat shifts (11 AM to 4 PM CST) every three weeks with a Wed off that week (paid for a full 8-hour shift)



System Requirements

-Internet connection with at least 10mbps speed

-Reliable backup internet connection

-Reliable power backup



Learn More About Us!


/hiring

title: Creative Video Editor & AI Specialist for Viral Fragrance Brand
description:
The Vibe:

We are One Bold Chemist. We don't do boring perfume ads. We go viral by mixing deep science (chemistry/ingredients) with internet humor, 
s, and fast-paced storytelling. We talk about everything from whale vomit (ambergris) to synthetic molecules.



The Role:

We are looking for a video editor who is a Master Asset Hunter and a visual storyteller. You don't just cut clips; you build a narrative.



What You Will Do:



Deep-Dive Asset Hunting: This is key. If the script mentions a specific "Sperm Whale eating a squid," you don't just grab a generic fish video. You hunt for the exact right stock footage to match the narration.



"Edutainment" Editing: Transform scripts about fragrance chemistry into high-energy TikToks/Reels that keep people watching.




 & Humor Integration: You know exactly when to cut to a funny 
 or sound effect (vine booms, overlays) to keep retention high without it being "cringe."



AI as a Bonus: Comfortable using AI tools (like Google Veo 3 or Nano Banana) to generate clips or images only when stock footage isn't enough. It's a tool to fill the gaps, not replace the craft.



Requirements:



Resourceful: You have the patience to scroll through stock libraries until you find the perfect clip.



Storytelling First: You understand pacing. You know how to visually explain complex topics in an entertaining way.



Proficient in Premiere Pro or CapCut.



Aesthetic Eye: You can balance "shitposting/
s" with a clean, premium look when needed.



How to Apply:



Send a link to your portfolio.



Highlight: Please point out 1-2 videos where you used storytelling (voiceover + stock footage/b-roll).



THE TEST: If we asked for a video clip of "a cinematic shot of a vanilla bean exploding into gold dust" and you couldn't find it on stock sites – how would you solve it? (Would you use AI? VFX? Keep looking? Tell us your process).



Start your subject line with "BOLD EDITOR" so we know you read this.

title: Facebook Ads Specialist (Lead Generation) – Local Flooring Business (Meta Ads)
description:
About the Role



I run a growing flooring business in Tampa, Florida selling luxury vinyl plank flooring through
 Ads and
 Marketplace.



We are actively running paid ads and need a skilled assistant who can IMPROVE ad performance, targeting, and lead quality — not just post content.



This role is focused on lead generation ads for a local service/product business, not e-commerce.



?



Your Main Objective



Lower cost per lead and increase qualified local inquiries (homeowners + contractors).



?



Core Responsibilities (HIGH PRIORITY)



1.
 Ads Management (Primary Task)

 • Monitor and optimize
 ad campaigns

 • Fix targeting issues (ex: ads showing nationwide instead of local)

 • Improve audience targeting (radius, interests, contractors, homeowners)

 • A/B test ad copy and creatives (flooring products & colors)

 • Reduce duplicate ad flags

 • Identify winning ads and scale them



?



2. Lead Generation Optimization

 • Improve quality of incoming leads

 • Help structure campaigns for local conversions

 • Suggest better campaign structures for multiple flooring products

 • Assist with retargeting strategy (if experienced)



?



3. Marketplace + Ad Coordination (Secondary)

 • Ensure Marketplace listings support ad campaigns

 • Refresh listings to maintain visibility

 • Align ad messaging with available flooring inventory



?



4. Basic Reporting (Weekly)

 • Cost per lead tracking

 • Ad performance summary

 • Recommendations for improvement (very important)



?



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (Do Not Apply Without This)

 • Proven experience with
 Ads Manager (Meta Ads)

 • Experience running LEAD GENERATION ads (not just engagement posts)

 • Experience with local business advertising

 • Strong understanding of audience targeting and ad optimization

 • Ability to communicate clearly in English



?



HUGE BONUS (Preferred)

 • Experience with home improvement, real estate, or construction ads

 • Experience with
 Marketplace marketing

 • Canva or ad creative experience

 • Experience handling inbound leads/messages



?



Work Hours



20 hours per week (long-term role)

Must overlap partially with US Eastern Time.



?



Pay



$5–$9/hour depending on experience + performance bonuses

(Bonuses for improved ad results and lower cost per lead)



?



IMPORTANT: Application Instructions



To be considered, include:

 1. Screenshots of
 Ads campaigns you have managed

 2. Example results (cost per lead, conversions, etc.)

 3. The word “LOCAL ADS” at the top of your application

 4. A short explanation of how you would fix ads targeting the wrong location



Applications without proof of ads experience will not be reviewed.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
About Us



Virtue Health has been transforming how mid-size employers self-fund through group purchasing for over 8 years, with our flagship Private Stop Loss Consortium helping them share risk, reduce volatility, and enhance benefits seamlessly. Our mission is to bring transparency and control to employers’ healthcare spending.







As Virtue Health continues to grow, we know our success depends on the talent we bring in.



That’s why we’re looking for the best, people like you, who act with integrity, reliability, responsibility, dedication, and a commitment to continuous improvement. Here, you’ll be immersed in a diverse, supportive environment where everyone is inspired to do their best work.







So, If you live by these values—Be Virtuous, Accountable, Do Whatever It Takes, Be consistent, have a growth mindset—you’ll thrive here.





Role Overview



The SDR plays in managing and overseeing the lead conversion process. You will act as a bridge between the marketing and sales teams, qualifying and converting leads to support our growth objectives







Key Responsibilities



Include but not limited too



Handle both outbound and inbound customer calls.

Set appointments between brokerages and our sales team.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date client profiles in the CRM system.

Demonstrate high-quality customer service by addressing brokerage needs and concerns.

Meet or exceed individual lead conversion and appointment-setting targets.

Develop an in-depth understanding of the US insurance industry to engage in meaningful conversations with potential clients.



Key Skills and Qualifications



At least 2 years of experience in a similar SDR role.

Proven success in client engagement and lead conversion.

Experience with CRM systems, preferably Hubspot

Strong communication skills in English (C1 level minimum).

A proactive approach with the ability to adapt to rapid changes and ambiguity.

Goal-oriented with a focus on driving results.

A customer-centric mindset with the ability to identify and address client needs.

Collaborative and a team player, capable of working with both marketing and sales teams.



Who This Role Is For



This role is for those who:



Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and embrace change with agility.

Excel in rapidly growing settings, navigating ambiguity with confidence and adaptability.

Are driven by excellence, always seeking to improve and raise the bar.

Operate with unwavering integrity, honesty, and strong ethical values.

Demonstrate consistency, follow-through, and a commitment to high standards.

Take full ownership of their responsibilities, hold themselves accountable, and seek solutions rather than excuses.

Go above and beyond, consistently putting in the effort to deliver exceptional results.

Embrace feedback, personal growth, and continuous learning as essential to their success.



Salary and Compensation



Our compensation structure is designed to reflect that increased responsibility, results, and leadership drive higher pay within our organization.



Virtue Health Recruitment Process



Pre-Screening Assessment

Cultural Interview

Skill Assessment

Skills Interview

Final Interview



Apply now to join our team and be part of a journey that makes a difference.

title: Beauty and Health Content Writer/ Editor
description:
Location: Remote



About Us:



Honey Hut PR is a UK-based digital PR agency specialising in health, wellness and beauty. We work with ambitious brands to deliver high-quality media coverage and compelling, well-researched content. We’re looking for a proactive, creative Content Writer + Editor to support our growing team. This role is ideal for a self-starter who wants to gain hands-on experience across exciting, fast-moving client accounts.



Key responsibilities:



- Editing and refining 6-8 content pieces per week, using our in-house AI content tool (e.g. B2C how-to guides, expert-led features, press launches)

- Improving structure, tone, clarity and flow of written drafts

- Embedding relevant client links accurately and naturally

- Generating strong content ideas and angles

- Designing simple social media posts for clients using Canva

- Repurposing content into blog posts

- Collaborating with the wider team



Full training provided.



Requirements:



- Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

- Strong editing skills with a keen eye for UK spelling, grammar and formatting

- Ability to manage deadlines and work efficiently

- Confidence using MS Word, Excel, Canva, ChatGPT, and Instagram

- Interest in health, wellness and beauty is an advantage

- Highly organised, self-motivated and comfortable working independently



What We Offer:



- Log Off Early Scheme: flexible working hours when daily tasks are completed and approved

- Ongoing training and mentorship in Digital PR

- Opportunity for increased responsibility and hours as the business grows

- Hands-on experience working with global health, wellness and beauty clients



How to Apply:



To apply, please complete all THREE steps below and send everything via
 to 



1. Please use “Content Writer + Editor Position” as the subject line.

2. Attach your CV

3. Record a new LOOM video (maximum 90 seconds) stating your relevant experience, and a bit about you and your interests



Please send the Loom link, do not attach a video file.



If successful, you’ll be contacted to arrange an interview and discuss next steps.

title: Website Project Manager
description:
APPLICATION LINK: 



ABOUT REMODEL TITANS

Remodel Titans is a specialized web design and SEO agency dedicated to helping kitchen and bathroom remodeling contractors dominate their local markets. We work exclusively with contractors across the United States, delivering high-impact websites, SEO strategies, and content that generate quality leads for our clients.



THE ROLE

We're looking for an experienced Website Project Manager to lead our project delivery team. You'll oversee the complete lifecycle of website projects—from initial client onboarding through final launch and ongoing SEO implementation. You'll manage and coordinate our team of developers, designers, and content writers while ensuring projects stay on schedule, meet quality standards, and exceed client expectations.

This is a hands-on leadership role perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, results-driven environment and wants to make a direct impact on business growth.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



- Project Leadership: Manage multiple website projects simultaneously, ensuring on-time delivery and budget adherence

- Team Coordination: Direct developers, designers, and content writers, delegating tasks clearly and maintaining accountability

- Client Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, providing regular updates and managing expectations

- Process Optimization: Develop and refine project workflows and standard operating procedures (SOPs) to improve efficiency

- Quality Assurance: Review deliverables for quality, functionality, and alignment with project requirements

- Timeline Management: Create detailed project schedules, track progress, and identify/resolve bottlenecks

- Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project records including specifications, timelines, and revisions

- Onboarding: Manage the client onboarding process to ensure smooth project kickoff

- Reporting: Provide regular status reports and analytics to leadership and clients



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



- Proven website project management experience (minimum 2+ years)

- Strong understanding of website development workflows, timelines, and deliverables

- Experience managing and coordinating remote or distributed teams

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

- Ability to juggle multiple projects and prioritize effectively

- Proficiency with project management tools (Asana, 
, ClickUp, etc.)

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

- Ability to work independently while maintaining alignment with team goals

- Problem-solving mindset with a focus on solutions



BONUS QUALIFICATIONS (Not Required)

- Experience with SEO strategy, implementation, and reporting

- Familiarity with WordPress or other CMS platforms

- Knowledge of conversion optimization and user experience principles

- Experience in the contractor, remodeling, or home services industry

- Understanding of Google My Business, local SEO, and Google Ads



WHAT WE OFFER

- Fully remote position

- Competitive compensation based on experience

- Work with a growing agency serving an underserved niche market

- Opportunity to build and lead processes from the ground up

- Collaborative team environment with supportive leadership

- Professional development opportunities



WORK ENVIRONMENT

- Remote-based team with flexible hours

- Fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

- Collaborative culture that values direct communication and authenticity

- Opportunity to implement systems and processes that drive efficiency

title: Leasing Assistant
description:
Join our Leasing Assistant team! Our team is committed to exceeding expectations through exceptional service, strong operational support, and a collaborative, professional work environment.



Job Description/Responsibilities



Monitor the CRM daily to identify and respond to new leasing leads in a timely manner.



Review incoming leads and determine the most effective outreach method to establish initial contact.



Prequalify prospective residents and actively engage them to generate interest in available properties.



Recommend alternative managed properties when prospects are not interested in the originally inquired property.



Coordinate with onsite leasing agents and property managers to schedule apartment showings based on availability.



Accurately document all lead interactions, communications, and notes in the CRM for onsite team reference.



Review and track onsite leasing agents’ feedback and notes following apartment showings.



Conduct follow-up communication with prospects after showings to advance the leasing process.



Guide and support the lead throughout the lease application process to ensure a smooth experience.



Once leases are signed and payments are received, coordinate with prospects and property managers to schedule move-in dates.



Prepare and generate basic reports on lead activity, leasing performance, and key metrics.



Regularly audit third-party listing platforms to ensure all available units are accurately listed.



Maintain up-to-date listings by ensuring accurate photos, pricing, availability, and property descriptions.



Tools Used:



Yardi



Microsoft Office Products











Job Requirements:



2-3 years of leasing, real estate, or related experience



Experience using CRM systems (Yardi preferred)



Strong communication and follow-up skills



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Ability to manage multiple leads efficiently



How to Apply:



Please submit your resume and a brief summary of your relevant experience through OLJ messaging only.

title: Google Maps Commercial Solar Building Researcher (Performance-Based)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Google Maps researcher to help identify qualified commercial building opportunities for solar energy projects.



This is NOT basic data entry.

You will be analyzing satellite view maps and identifying specific types of buildings based on clear qualification criteria.



Your task:



• Open Google Maps (satellite view)

• Scan a defined geographic area

• Identify commercial/industrial buildings

• Verify they meet qualification criteria

• Save Google Maps URL into a spreadsheet



Qualification criteria include:



• Commercial or industrial use (NO residential homes)

• Roof size approx. 200m²+ (visual estimation)

• Must have an active website

• Must NOT already have solar panels installed

• Must NOT be a shared multi-unit building



Ideal candidate:



• Strong attention to detail

• Experience with Google Maps research

• Comfortable using satellite view

• Able to follow strict qualification rules

• Bonus: experience in GIS, real estate research, or lead generation



Payment Structure:

Ongoing work paid per project/number of qualified buildings.



To apply:

Write the word “SOLAR” at the top of your application.



Briefly explain your experience using Google Maps or doing research.



Confirm you are comfortable working with satellite view.



Applications without the word “SOLAR” will not be reviewed.



If qualified you will performa paid test task to verify your abilities (small area with fixed payment)

title: Products & Collections Lister – Shopify Dropshipping (Fashion niche)
description:
Location: Remote





Job Type



Full-time or Part-time

• 4–8 hours per day. Workload may vary depending on product launches and store needs

• Minimum 6 days/week



Commitment: Long-term position (3+ months)





About Us



We are a fast-growing e-commerce company operating fashion dropshipping stores with hundreds of products and multiple collections launched every week.



We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Product & Collections Lister who understands fashion dropshipping and can efficiently manage product imports, optimization, and collection organization.



This role requires speed, precision, and strong Shopify knowledge.





Job Description



You will be responsible for importing and optimizing products and collections weekly while ensuring accuracy, proper pricing, translations, visuals, and collection structure.



You must be comfortable working with hundreds of products and making bulk edits efficiently.





Responsibilities



* Import one or multiple products and/or collections per day



* Use a prompt in Poky to import collections quickly



* Check and correct product translations



* Change product order inside collections based on competitor order



* Convert and modify prices in bulk using Hextom



* Correct spelling errors in bulk using Hextom



* Add size guides using BF Size Charts



* Check automatic discounts are properly working



* Add and modify theme templates to personalize product pages per collection



* Understand basic HTML to quickly identify and fix issues (formatting, design etc.)



* Use Shopify reports to identify our bestsellers and reorder collections



* Update product tags and internal product links



* Change product backgrounds colors in bulk using Photoroom



* Generate AI backgrounds using Higgsfield





Requirements



* Minimum 1 year of experience as a product & collection lister for a Shopify dropshipping business, including at least 3 months in the fashion niche



* Proven experience with:

  * Shopify

  * Hextom (Bulk Product Edit)

  * Poky with prompts

  * Slack or 

  * Google Sheets

  * DeepL & ChatGPT (for product translations)

  * Photoroom

  * Higgsfield (or other AI background tools)

We'll give you free access to all these tools



* Strong attention to detail



* Ability to work under daily deadlines



* Basic HTML knowledge (understanding formatting errors and theme edits)



* Experience managing hundreds of products



* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal



* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive



* Ability to work independently without constant supervision



* Long-term mindset and reliability





Compensation



* $3/hour during the first 2 weeks (trial period)

* $4/hour after successful trial

* $5+/hour if promoted to Product Lister Manager



Payment bi-weekly or monthly.

Salary increases based on performance and responsibilities.





How to Apply



Please send your application before February 18 at 11:59 PM (Philippines time).



To confirm that you carefully read this job post, start your application message with the number “214”. Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Assistant (Phone, Sales & Scheduling) — Refresh Cleaning Plus
description:
About Us







Refresh Cleaning Plus is a growing home service company in the United States providing window cleaning, pressure washing, gutter cleaning, and exterior cleaning services. We are building a reliable long-term team and looking for a dependable Virtual Assistant who is comfortable speaking on the phone and helping customers.







This is a stable, long-term position with room to grow into management or team leader roles.



What You’ll Do







You will act as the first point of contact for customers.







Primary Responsibilities



Answer inbound calls from customers



Book jobs and schedule appointments



Follow up with estimates and unsold leads



Make outbound calls (light sales / follow-ups)



Respond to text messages and
s



Update customer information in CRM



Confirm upcoming appointments



Handle reschedules and cancellations







Additional Tasks



Data entry



Basic administrative support



Organizing job notes for technicians



Occasional research or misc. tasks



Requirements







We are looking for someone reliable and confident speaking to customers.







Must Have



Excellent spoken English (very clear)



Comfortable on the phone (not shy)



Friendly and professional personality



Reliable internet (minimum 25 Mbps)



Quiet work environment



Good computer skills



Able to work U.S. business hours consistently







Preferred (Not Required)



Customer service experience



Sales experience



Call center experience



Experience with Jobber, Housecall Pro, or CRM systems



Personality We Want



Positive attitude



Takes initiative



Organized



Honest and dependable



Not afraid to talk to customers



Training







We provide full training and scripts.



You do NOT need prior cleaning industry experience.



Growth Opportunities







This role can grow into:



Team leader



Quality control



Sales manager



Operations assistant







We prefer long-term team members.



How to Apply







Please include:



A short voice recording introducing yourself (VERY IMPORTANT)



Your internet speed test



Resume



Answer this question:

title: Controller (CPA Preferred)
description:
Controller (CPA Preferred)

Type: Full-Time

Reports To: CFO / Founder (US-Based)



About Us



We are a fast-growing US-based digital marketing company generating $10M+ in annual revenue, with multiple LLCs operating under one ownership structure. Our team is distributed across the US and the Philippines. As we continue to scale, we are seeking a highly experienced Controller to lead accounting operations, oversee multi-entity financial management, and build scalable financial infrastructure to support continued growth.



This is a senior-level leadership role with significant ownership and visibility.



The Role



The Controller will own the full accounting function across multiple US-based entities. This role requires strong knowledge of US GAAP, multi-entity accounting, intercompany transactions, and consolidated reporting.. You will work directly with executive leadership and external US CPA firms to ensure financial accuracy, compliance, and operational efficiency.



This is not a bookkeeping role — this is a strategic, hands-on accounting leadership position.



Key Responsibilities

Financial Leadership & Close Management



Lead monthly, quarterly, and annual close processes

Prepare accurate GAAP-compliant financial statements

Deliver consolidated reporting across multiple LLCs

Maintain clean general ledger structure and documentation



Multi-Entity & Intercompany Accounting

Manage accounting across several related US entities

Oversee intercompany allocations, eliminations, and reconciliations

Ensure entity-level performance visibility and reporting clarity



Revenue & Agency Accounting

Oversee revenue recognition (retainers, project-based, performance contracts)

Properly account for client pass-through ad spend

Monitor gross margins, operating leverage, and cost structure



Cash Flow & Financial Planning

Manage cash flow forecasting and working capital planning

Support budgeting and financial planning initiatives

Ensure appropriate tax reserves and owner distributions



Tax & Compliance Coordination

Act as liaison with US-based CPA and tax advisors

Support multi-state compliance and 1099 reporting

Ensure audit readiness and strong internal controls



Systems & Process Development

Improve and document accounting processes

Optimize accounting tech stack (QuickBooks, 
, Ramp/Brex, payroll platforms, etc.)

Lead and coordinate accounting support tea
mbers (US & PH-based staff)



Required Qualifications



8+ years of progressive accounting experience

Proven experience managing accounting for US-based companies

Strong knowledge of US GAAP and financial reporting standards

Direct experience with multi-entity accounting and intercompany transactions

Experience supporting companies generating $10M+ in revenue

Advanced proficiency in QuickBooks Online or equivalent systems

Strong leadership and remote team collaboration skills



Preferred



CPA strongly preferred 

Experience in digital marketing, agency, consulting, or service-based business

Experience building accounting systems in a scaling organization

Familiarity with distributed teams (US + offshore staff)



What Success Looks Like

Month-end close completed accurately and on time

Consolidated reporting provides clear financial visibility

Intercompany accounting is clean and structured

Cash flow is proactively managed

Financial systems are scalable for continued growth beyond $10M



Why Join Us?



High-impact leadership role in a growing US company

Direct access to executive leadership

Remote-first environment

Opportunity to build and scale financial operations across multiple ventures





To Apply



Please submit your resume along with a an audio or video intoduction detailing:

Description of experience managing US-based entities

Experience with multi-entity or consolidated accounting

Revenue range of companies previously supported

Responsibilities

, X, YouTube, etc.).

Outreach to influencers via
, social media platforms, and influencer marketing platforms to initiate partnerships and negotiate collaboration terms.

title: Operations Manager - Real Estate Investing & SaaS
description:
ABOUT US

We operate two growing businesses in Philadelphia, USA:



Kaizen Acquisitions - Real estate wholesaling company acquiring off-market properties

Automize REI - AI-powered SaaS platform built on GoHighLevel for real estate investors



We're looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Operations Manager who can handle data management, lead processing, client support, and systems building across both businesses.



WHAT YOU'LL DO DAILY

Data & Lead Management (Primary Focus):



Pull and upload lead lists from InvestorBase, InvestorLift, REsimpli, PropWire, PropStream, Batch Leads

Maintain organized naming system and upload schedules (daily/weekly)

Review and qualify incoming leads across multiple channels

Initiate and monitor automated workflows in GoHighLevel

Run dispositions and coordinate buyer outreach

Track lead sources, conversion rates, and campaign performance



SaaS Client Operations (Automize REI):



Onboard new clients and set up their GoHighLevel accounts

Monitor client usage and respond to support tickets

Test AI agents (SMS and voice automation) for quality

Update templates, workflows, and automation recipes

Maintain client success documentation

Learn GoHighLevel backend for basic troubleshooting



Systems & Content Creation:



Create step-by-step guides, SOPs, and training videos (Loom)

Research AI tools and document optimization strategies

Build process documentation and pipeline guides

Update company website and upload property photos

Generate weekly/monthly performance reports

Keep all files and systems organized



Communication & Deal Support:



Make outbound calls to leads when needed

Schedule appointments and send SMS campaigns

Track deals through pipeline stages

Coordinate with title companies, inspectors, and contractors

Update CRM and manage document collection





WHO YOU ARE

MUST HAVE (Deal Breakers):



Real estate investing experience (wholesaling, flipping, or REI virtual assistant)

GoHighLevel experience OR proven ability to learn complex software quickly

Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills (formulas, data management, pivot tables)

CRM experience (REsimpli, Podio, Salesforce, or similar)

Excellent English communication (written and spoken) - C1 level minimum

Systems builder mindset - you create processes and stay extremely organized

Video creation skills (Loom, screen recording, tutorials)



STRONG PREFERENCE:



Experience pulling lists from PropStream, BatchLeads, or similar platforms

Transaction coordination or disposition experience

Comfortable with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, automation)

Previous SaaS or tech startup experience

Graphic design skills (Canva)



YOUR PERSONALITY:



Self-starter who takes initiative without constant supervision

Detail-oriented - nothing slips through the cracks

Problem-solver who finds solutions, not excuses

Fast learner who embraces new technology

Proactive communicator who asks questions when unclear

Process-driven and loves building systems



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS



Salary: $800 - $1,200 USD per month (based on experience)

Payment: Monthly via PayPal, Wise, or Payoneer

Growth: Performance reviews every 90 days with raise opportunities

Bonuses: Potential performance bonuses based on deals closed and client retention

Long-term: This is a career opportunity with room to grow into Senior Operations or Account Management roles

Paid Time Off: 5 days paid leave after 6 months, 10 days after 1 year

Training: We invest in your development - courses, certifications, tools





WHY WORK WITH US?

Stable, Growing Companies - We're scaling both businesses and need the right person to grow with us

Learn Cutting-Edge Tech - Work with AI automation, GoHighLevel, and latest real estate tools

Variety - No boring, repetitive work. You'll touch multiple areas of the business

Direct Impact - Your work directly affects company revenue and growth

Supportive Environment - We value communication, feedback, and continuous improvement

Career Path - Opportunity to transition into higher-level roles as we expand



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



Please submit the following:



Your resume highlighting real estate and/or GoHighLevel experience

Cover letter answering these questions:



What real estate investing experience do you have? (wholesaling, VA work, transaction coordination, etc.)

What is your GoHighLevel experience level? (beginner/intermediate/advanced)

Describe a system or process you built from scratch. What problem did it solve?

What tools do you use daily to stay organized?





Video introduction (2-3 minutes on Loom):



Introduce yourself

Walk through a spreadsheet you've created (any topic)

Explain why you're perfect for this role





Answer these screening questions:



Have you ever pulled lead lists from PropStream, BatchLeads, or similar platforms? If yes, which ones?



On a scale of 1-10, how would you rate your Excel/Google Sheets skills? Give an example.



What CRMs have you used? Which are you most comfortable with?



Have you created training videos or SOPs before? Share a link if available.

title: Performance Strategist - Meta Ads
description:
We’re looking for a mid-to-senior Creative Strategist, Paid Media to own and scale performance creative across paid social and video channels. This is a fully remote role where you’ll operate as a core member of our growth team, driving creative strategy that directly impacts revenue.



This role sits at the intersection of psychology, storytelling, and data. You won’t just launch ads, you’ll build scalable creative systems that consistently turn insights into repeatable winners.

You’ll collaborate closely with media buyers, editors, designers, and growth leaders to develop, test, and scale creative that drives profitable acquisition across channels.



What You’ll Own

• Lead creative strategy for paid acquisition across Meta, TikTok, YouTube, and emerging channels

• Develop performance-driven concepts, hooks, angles, and messaging frameworks rooted in customer psychology and data

• Build and manage a structured creative testing roadmap with clear hypotheses, success criteria, and scaling logic

• Analyze performance metrics (CPA, CTR, hook rate, thumb-stop rate, hold rate) to inform creative direction

• Break down performance at the hook, first 3 seconds, body, and CTA level to identify optimization opportunities

• Identify creative fatigue, gaps, and scaling opportunities using tools like Motion, ETV, and native platform analytics

• Research top-performing DTC beauty brands to uncover patterns, winning formats, and whitespace opportunities

• Translate insights into clear, actionable creative briefs for editors and designers

• Partner closely with media buying to align creative strategy with account structure, bidding, and scaling decisions

• Systemize learnings through naming conventions, testing logs, and performance frameworks so insights compound over time



What We’re Looking For

• Experience owning paid social creative strategy within a DTC or consumer brand

• Deep understanding of performance metrics and how they translate into creative decisions

• Proven track record of building structured testing frameworks — not just individual ad concepts

• Strong experimentation mindset with a bias toward action

• Ability to collaborate effectively in a remote environment



Why This Role

This is an opportunity to help build and scale a best-in-class performance creative engine inside a fast-growing beauty brand — from anywhere. You’ll have real ownership, visibility, and autonomy to create frameworks that drive sustainable, profitable growth
