title: Full Time UGC Video Editor (2.5.26)
description:
Hey there, we're looking to hire a world-class UGC video editor for our e-commerce brand. Must have experience editing
 
 ads for e-commerce brands.



Your Role:

- Edit 15-25 direct-response ads weekly across formats: AI avatars, UGC, b-roll + voiceover, testimonials

- Work from creative briefs and scripts provided by our strategists to execute concepts rapidly

- Maintain a constant pipeline of fresh creatives to prevent ad fatigue and sustain performance



-- How to Apply



1. Create a brief Loom video for me going over the following:

- A short introduction about yourself and tell us a bit about your experience as a DR Video Editor

- Years of Video Editing Experience

- List some brands you have worked with (and annual revenue if known)

- What makes you a good candidate for this job?

- What is your current work availability, and do you have any commitments that may affect your working full-time? Can you work Saturdays and Sundays?

title: Marketing Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation Focus) - JAS
description:
Marketing Operations Support Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation Focus)



Full-Time | Remote | Contract-Based



I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Marketing Operations Support Virtual Assistant with strong lead generation and marketing support experience. This role is critical to supporting day-to-day marketing operations, improving lead flow, and keeping systems running smoothly. You’ll work closely with leadership and the project manager and directly support core growth activities.



This is not a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant role. It’s a hands-on marketing ops + lead gen support position.



Role Overview



Your primary responsibility will be lead generation through Upwork and LinkedIn, supported by structured workflows, AI-assisted processes, and clear performance targets. You’ll also assist with light backend operations, reporting, and content ideation using documented systems.



Once trained, you’re expected to work independently, think critically, and execute with consistency.



Key Responsibilities (Summary)



1. Upwork Lead Generation (Top Priority)



Monitor Upwork for relevant opportunities aligned with target client profiles



Draft and submit high-quality proposals using provided templates and brand voice



Use AI tools to personalize proposals efficiently (not copy-paste)



Track proposal performance and provide weekly insights on results



2. LinkedIn Engagement & Lead Support



Post thoughtful, AI-assisted comments daily using curated content feeds



Review and refine AI-generated drafts to maintain an authentic voice



Track engagement trends and submit weekly summaries



3. Lead Data Management & Reporting



Clean, verify, and maintain lead data in Google Sheets



Complete follow-up and performance reports with zero missing fields



Flag data or quality issues immediately



4. AI-Assisted Content Ideation (Light Task)



Review shared articles and videos via Slack



Extract insights using guided AI prompts



Create content idea outlines using provided templates



5. Backend Operations Support



Manage personal tasks in the project management system



Provide light operational and workflow support as needed



Tools You’ll Use



Upwork (essential)



LinkedIn



AI Tools: ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity



Google Workspace: Google Sheets, Docs, Gmail, Calendar



Slack



Motion (or similar task/project management tool)



Required Skills & Experience



Minimum of 3 years proven work experience as a Virtual Assistant supporting marketing agencies or B2B service-based companies



Hands-on experience in lead generation, marketing operations, and workflow support



Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think through processes and resolve issues independently



Advanced comfort using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity) for drafting, research, and productivity



Ability to follow documented processes precisely while understanding the purpose behind each workflow



Excellent written English with professional grammar and communication skills



Extremely detail-oriented with high accuracy in data entry, reporting, and submissions



Self-directed work style; able to execute independently after training



Reliable internet connection and professional remote work setup



What Makes You a Strong Fit



You troubleshoot instead of stalling when something isn’t clear



You use AI strategically, not blindly



You notice patterns and suggest small process improvements



You communicate proactively and flag issues early



You value consistency, accuracy, and accountability



Application Requirements (Important)



To be considered, please submit all of the following:



Updated Resume / CV



Portfolio (if applicable to marketing, lead gen, or ops work)



2-minute self-introduction video explaining your experience and why you’re a good fit for this Marketing Operations & Lead Gen VA role



Applications missing any of the above will not be prioritized.

title: GoHighLevel + Zapier Specialist (Automation & CRM Expert)
description:
About Our Company



We are a U.S.-based digital marketing company that builds systems, automations, and CRM solutions for home service businesses (concrete coatings, plumbing, electricians, landscaping, etc.).

We rely heavily on GoHighLevel, Zapier, and automation processes to support our clients nationwide.



We are looking for a highly skilled GoHighLevel + Zapier Specialist who can help us build, manage, and improve our internal systems. This is a key role inside our company — you will be working directly with our leadership team to help shape the structure of this department.



Position Overview



We are hiring someone who is experienced, proactive, and confident in managing and building:

GoHighLevel workflows, forms, calendars, funnels

Complex Zapier automations

Client account setups and integrations

Data flows between platforms

Technical troubleshooting across CRM tools

You will play a major role in helping build the internal structure, SOPs, and best practices for this department.

This is a long-term position with potential for growth into a leadership-level systems role.



Key Responsibilities

GoHighLevel (GHL)

Create and manage workflows, triggers, pipelines, and automations

Build and maintain client accounts using snapshots

Troubleshoot workflow issues, delays, double-messaging, and delivery errors

Set up funnels, forms, calendars, and user permissions

Ensure lead notifications and automations are functioning correctly



Zapier

Build and maintain multi-step Zaps

Troubleshoot Zap errors and automation failures

Connect GHL with Google Sheets,
 Lead Ads, Calendars, and other tools

Use filters, paths, formatters, and webhooks to improve automation logic



Technical Setup

Connect domains/DNS (GoDaddy, Cloudflare)

Configure
 delivery systems (SMTP, DNS records)

Diagnose integration issues across multiple apps

Assist in mapping and documenting workflows

System Development

Help create and improve internal SOPs

Assist in designing a scalable technical foundation for our client onboarding

Recommend improvements to automations and workflow architecture

Ensure systems remain stable, reliable, and efficient



Skills & Requirements

Must-Have Skills

1+ years of GoHighLevel experience

Strong Zapier experience (filters, paths, formatters, webhooks)

Confident in building workflows, pipelines, forms, calendars

Ability to troubleshoot automation failures

Experience connecting domains, DNS, and integrations

Strong problem-solving skills

Good English communication skills

Ability to work independently and think proactively

Nice-to-Have Skills


 / Integromat

Basic HTML/CSS

API or webhook experience

WordPress familiarity

Experience working with U.S. clients or agencies

 Lead Ads integration experience



Who We’re Looking For



We want someone who is:

Highly detail-oriented

A strong problem solver

Tech-savvy and process-driven

Able to work independently without micromanagement

Comfortable helping build systems, not just following them

Communicative, reliable, and consistent

Excited to grow with a company long-term

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys automations, systems architecture, and improving backend workflows.



Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience

Long-term, stable position

Opportunity to grow into a lead technical role

Work closely with the company founder

13th-month pay

Performance-based bonuses

Flexible work hours (with some EST overlap)

A supportive and growth-focused team



Hiring Timeline

We are hiring immediately and will begin interviews as soon as applications come in.

If you're talented, reliable, and love building systems — we’d love to meet you.



Apply here using this form:

title: We're Hiring: Discord DM Setter — xTrades
description:
About Us

xTrades is a social trading platform. We help people learn how to trade and copy the trades of experienced traders. Our community is growing fast, and we need someone to connect with new members.



The Role

You will be the first person our leads talk to. When someone joins xTrades, you reach out to them on 
. You welcome them, walk them through what we offer, and book them on a free 15-minute onboarding call with our team.

You are not closing sales. You are opening doors. Your job is to start the conversation, build trust, and get people excited to learn more.



What You'll Do

You will send direct messages to new leads on 
 every day. You will guide them through the xTrades platform and answer basic questions about how copy trading works. You will book calls between leads and our closers. You will follow up with people who haven't responded. You will track your outreach and report your numbers.



What We're Looking For

You write in strong, clear English. Your grammar is solid and your tone is friendly. You have a basic understanding of the stock market and investing. You don't need to be an expert, but you should know the basics. You are comfortable sending a high volume of messages each day. You are organized and reliable. You show up and do the work.



Nice to Have

Experience with 
 communities. Background in sales, lead generation, or appointment setting. Interest in trading or financial markets. Familiarity with social or copy trading platforms.



How to Apply

Send us a message with a short intro about yourself. Tell us why this role fits you. Include a sample DM you would send to a new lead who just joined xTrades.

title: EXecutive assistant
description:
Full-Time Executive Virtual Assistant for the CEO of MAUCIT

Type: Full-Time | Location: Remote | Timezone: GMT (Nouakchott, Mauritania)



About MAUCIT

MAUCIT is a forward-thinking manufacturing company driven by innovation, quality, and operational excellence. We are building a company that sets new standards in our industry, and we need a world-class support system behind our CEO to make it happen.

We believe the most undervalued asset of any CEO is an exceptional Executive Assistant. Our CEO relies on their EA to save up to 60% of their time — turning 90-hour weeks into focused, high-impact 36-hour ones. This role is at the heart of how we operate.



About The Role

We are looking for a stellar Executive Virtual Assistant to work directly with our CEO. As an EA, your main job is to help our CEO save time, multiply leverage, and focus on the work that only they can do. This is a long-term role where you will be respected, valued, and grow quickly.

You will serve as the CEO's right hand — handling everything from operations and communications to research and supplier management. If we do something more than three times, we build a playbook for it, and you'll be at the center of creating and running those systems.



What You'll Do

Your week will be dynamic and varied. Here's a snapshot of the responsibilities:

Operations & Supply Chain



Supplier follow-ups: track orders, manage communications, and ensure on-time delivery

Production scheduling: coordinate timelines, update trackers, and flag delays

Order tracking from placement through delivery and fulfillment

Invoicing and light bookkeeping (reconciliation, expense tracking)

Update financial, KPI, and inventory spreadsheets

Manage procurement documentation and vendor contracts



CEO Support & Administration



Effectively manage the CEO's schedule, expenses, and all communications related to meetings, calls, events, and interviews

Collect and drive a daily list of key decisions the CEO needs to make

Draft and manage
s, correspondence, and follow-ups

Prepare meeting agendas, take notes, and track action items

Clean up transcribed meeting notes (e.g., Otter.ai)

Remind the CEO of important tasks, deadlines, and events



Sales, Marketing & Research



Market research: industry trends, competitor analysis, potential partners

Reach out to potential clients and manage lead lists

Manage
 campaigns and CRM data entry

Repurpose content across social media channels (LinkedIn,
, etc.)

Prep sales decks and presentations using Google Slides

Create reports and dashboards for internal and external use



Systems, Processes & Projects



Create and maintain systems and playbooks in Notion — anything done 3+ times gets documented

Spreadsheet creation and management in Google Sheets

Manage data and workflows in Odoo (ERP)

Coordinate with tea
mbers on cross-functional projects

Assist with recruiting, onboarding new employees, and HR administration

Draft investor updates and internal communications





Who You Are

We're not just looking for someone who checks boxes — we're looking for someone who thinks like an operator and acts like an owner.



Experienced: At least 3 years of direct experience as an Executive Assistant, Administrative Assistant, or Project Manager. (That said, we value coachability over pedigree — if you're smart and fast, we'd rather teach you our way than unlearn someone else's.)

Quick learner: You're smart, thorough, and fast. You pick up new tools and processes with ease.

Problem solver: You don't wait to be told what to do. You see what needs doing and you do it.

Strong communicator: You speak and write fluent English, or you are highly comfortable using translation tools to communicate effectively in English. You're at ease communicating via
, Slack, voice messages, or video (Loom/Zoom). Clear, professional communication is an absolute must.

Tech-savvy: You're comfortable with Google Workspace, Notion, Odoo, and learning new software. You can handle multiple applications open at once without missing a beat.

Dependable: You show up, you follow through, and you expect the same from your boss in return.

Thoughtful & competitive: You take pride in producing high-quality work. You love being really good at your job.

Action-oriented: You're comfortable making decisions in the CEO's absence. If you screw up, you own it and fix it.





Tools You'll Use



Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Gmail, Calendar)

Notion (documentation, playbooks, project tracking)

Odoo (ERP — invoicing, inventory, production management)

Slack (team communication)

Zoom / Loom (video meetings and async communication)

Otter.ai or similar (meeting transcription)

Social media platforms (LinkedIn,
, etc.)





Requirements



3+ years of experience in an EA, administrative, or project management role (preferred but not required for exceptional candidates)

Fluent English — written and spoken — OR strong comfort with translation tools to communicate professionally in English

Fluency in French or Arabic is a strong plus

Fast, reliable internet and a computer that can handle multiple applications simultaneously

Available to start within 2 weeks of a job offer

Comfortable working in the GMT timezone (Nouakchott, Mauritania hours)





Why Join MAUCIT



Work directly with the CEO — this is a high-impact, high-trust role

Long-term position with real opportunities for growth and advancement

Be respected and valued as a core member of the leadership support team

Help build and scale a manufacturing company from the ground up

Flexible remote work environment





How To Apply

We've designed a thoughtful application process to find the right fit for both sides. Please follow the instructions below carefully — how you apply is part of the evaluation.



Submit your application with a short cover letter explaining why you're a great fit for this role. Generic applications will not be considered.

Include a short Loom video (2–3 minutes) answering this question: "Where do you live, and what do you enjoy most about your daily routine?"

Attach your resume/CV.



Our Screening Process:

1st Screen — Application review (do you follow directions and communicate well?)

2nd Screen — Loom video review (communication skills and personality fit)

3rd Screen — Zoom video interview with the CEO

4th Screen — Final interview and decision



Ready to become the CEO's secret weapon? Apply now and show us what you've got.

This is a high-impact leadership role where you will bridge business goals and technical execution, guide architectural decisions, and lead a multidisciplinary team toward building a secure, scalable product.



You’ll work closely with founders and product leaders, turning complex ideas into reliable systems while fostering a collaborative engineering culture.



Job Responsibilities:



Lead, mentor, and support a team of developers, designers, and product managers

Serve as the technical bridge between stakeholders and the engineering team

Make strategic decisions on system architecture, tools, and long-term scalability

Oversee end-to-end development across frontend and backend systems

Ensure code quality, security, performance, and maintainability

Collaborate with the Product Manager to prioritize work, manage technical debt, and deliver features on time

Promote a team-first, problem-solving culture focused on product success



Technical Skills Requirements:



Full Stack Development: Strong experience using TypeScript across frontend and backend

Backend: 5+ years working with Node.js, preferably using FastifyJS or NestJS

Frontend: Advanced proficiency in ReactJS and Next.js

APIs: Proven experience designing secure, scalable RESTful APIs

Telephony & Communication: 2+ years integrating Twilio (voice, SMS, or automation workflows)

DevOps: Hands-on experience with Docker and containerized environments

Payments & Integrations: Experience with Stripe (SaaS subscriptions) and Zapier developer integrations

AI Workflow Orchestration: Experience with prompt engineering and frameworks such as LangChain or LlamaIndex

Leadership Experience: Proven experience leading or mentoring a development team, including guiding technical decisions, conducting code reviews, supporting career growth, and collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders.

Problem-Solving: Strong ability to troubleshoot complex systems and deliver elegant solutions



Interested? Please send in your applications to 
 with your updated resume & short video introduction.

title: Operations Assistant - Customer Service
description:
Role: Operations Assistant (Healthcare VA)

Job Type & Working Hours: Full Time, 5 AM to 2 PM (US EST)



General Responsibilities:

Fielding inbound questions from patients undergoing telemedicine treatment

Answering questions about visits, prescriptions, and updates

The job is high volume and involves typical customer service questions like "Where's my order?" and "When's my next appointment?"

If a question is straightforward, the representative should answer it

If a question is not suited for the representative to answer, they should refer it to a nurse or doctor

This role involves a lot of communication with patients



Customer/Client Onboarding:

This role involves bringing new customers onto the company's platform

Working through processes and checklists to ensure systems are set up to work with the company's

Making sure everything needed has been acquired, and everything they need has been shared

The work is very detail-oriented

Involves a lot of communication back and forth with the customer



Internal:

Maintaining constant communication within the company/team/supervisors



Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in customer service, healthcare background preferred

With a stable internet connection and a backup provider

With reliable desktop/laptop and peripherals for remote work

Working knowledge of the following: Google Workspace and Slack, (Motion, a PLUS)

title: Accounting Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Accountant to join our team. The Accounting Manager  will play a pivotal role in overseeing our financial operations, ensuring compliance with GAAP and US Taxation regulations, and managing financial reporting. This position requires a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with a strong background in accounting, auditing, and taxation. The ideal candidate should also possess exceptional analytical skills and expertise in financial software such as Quickbooks and Microsoft Excel.



Responsibilities:



Financial Management:

Oversee and manage all financial activities, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting.

Ensure the company's financial operations are compliant with GAAP and US Taxation regulations.



Auditing and Compliance:

Conduct regular financial audits to maintain accuracy and integrity of financial data.

Work with external auditors to facilitate annual financial audits.



Taxation:

Manage all aspects of tax compliance, including federal, state, and local tax filings.

Stay updated on changes in tax regulations and implement necessary adjustments.



Accounting Software Expertise:

Utilize expertise in Quickbooks, Netsuite, and Microsoft Excel to streamline financial processes and reporting.

Implement and maintain effective accounting systems and internal controls.



Financial Reporting:

Prepare and present accurate and timely financial statements to senior management and stakeholders.

Generate financial analysis reports for decision-making purposes.



Cash Flow Management:

Monitor and manage cash flow to ensure sufficient liquidity for operational needs.

Develop and implement cash flow forecasting models.



Financial Strategy:

Collaborate with executive leadership to develop and execute financial strategies that support business goals and growth.



Requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master's degree preferred).

Certified Public Accountant (CPA) certification is required.

Extensive knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and US Taxation regulations.

Proven auditing experience, preferably in a managerial role.

Expertise in financial software, including Quickbooks, Netsuite, and Microsoft Excel.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and leadership abilities.

Detail-oriented and highly organized.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Experience working with US companies





If you meet these qualifications and are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, please submit your resume and an audio introduction of your qualifications

title: Strategic Partnership Consultant
description:

Relationship Growth & Expansion

title: Market research analyst (B2B) – remote
description:
About the role

We’re hiring a market research analyst to support our B2B growth team with fast, accurate research that turns into outreach-ready target lists. You will map markets, identify the right companies and decision makers, and deliver clean data that the sales team can act on immediately.



This is a remote, full-time role (40 hours/week). You work independently, follow clear weekly priorities, and document your work so it’s easy to audit and reuse.



Key responsibilities



market mapping: build lists of target industries, segments, and use cases based on clear criteria



company research: identify relevant companies, validate fit, and collect key firmographic data (size, geography, offering, signals)



contact research: find the right decision makers and verify role relevance (titles, department, seniority)



data quality: keep research structured, consistent, and deduplicated in spreadsheets/CRM



insight briefs: produce short summaries on competitors, positioning, and messaging angles based on what you find



process improvement: refine research workflows to increase speed and accuracy over time



Requirements



1–3 years in B2B market research, lead research, sales ops support, or similar roles



strong written English and clear, structured communication



high attention to detail. you don’t “guess” when data is unclear



confident using spreadsheets (filters, validation, cleaning)



comfortable researching across websites, directories, LinkedIn, and company reports



you can manage a full workday without supervision and hit weekly output targets



Nice to have



experience researching European B2B markets



familiarity with common B2B tools (LinkedIn, Apollo, Crunchbase or alternatives)



basic understanding of sales funnels and outbound prospecting



What success looks like (first 90 days)



30 days: you deliver accurate target lists that match criteria, with clean formatting and clear sources



60 days: you consistently produce weekly output and reduce “bad-fit” records through better validation



90 days: you improve one research workflow (speed or accuracy) and contribute useful competitor/market insights that improve targeting



Work setup



remote, work from home



full-time, 40 hours/week



outcome-driven. quality and consistency matter more than busywork



Compensation

competitive hourly rate based on experience and performance.



How to apply

Apply with your CV and answer these two questions:



describe a research project you’ve done and what the output was used for



what steps do you take to verify company fit and decision-maker relevance?



Job type: full-time

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work location: remote

Benefits: work from home

title: CRM management specialist (B2B) – remote
description:
About the role

We’re hiring a CRM management specialist to keep our CRM clean, reliable, and useful for daily execution. You will own data quality, pipeline hygiene, reporting basics, and the operational routines that make sales and outreach predictable.



This is a remote, full-time role (40 hours/week). You work independently, follow weekly priorities, and document changes so the team always knows what’s happening inside the CRM.



Key responsibilities



CRM hygiene: maintain accurate records, stages, owners, and next steps across leads and deals



data quality: deduplicate, standardize fields, fix broken records, and enforce naming conventions



pipeline operations: ensure every active lead/deal has a clear status, next action, and timeline



workflow support: set up and maintain basic automations (tasks, reminders, simple routing)



reporting: track core KPIs (activity, conversion rates, pipeline movement) and create simple weekly summaries



user support: help tea
mbers follow the CRM process, troubleshoot common issues, and improve adoption



documentation: keep a simple CRM playbook updated (rules, fields, definitions, how we work)



Requirements



1–3 years in CRM operations, sales ops support, admin support, or similar roles



confident with any modern CRM (HubSpot, Salesforce, Pipedrive, Zoho, etc.)



strong written English and structured communication



high attention to detail. you spot errors fast and fix them correctly



comfortable in spreadsheets (filtering, cleaning, validation)



you can manage a full workday without supervision and hit weekly deliverables consistently



Nice to have



experience supporting SDR/BDR outbound workflows (sequences, task queues, lead stages)



basic understanding of B2B funnel metrics



experience writing simple process docs and SOPs



What success looks like (first 90 days)



30 days: CRM is clean, fields are consistent, duplicates are reduced, and the pipeline is readable



60 days: weekly reporting is stable and decisions are based on real data, not guesses



90 days: one operational improvement is implemented (process, automation, or reporting) that saves time every week



Work setup



remote, work from home



full-time, 40 hours/week



outcome-driven. accuracy and consistency matter



Compensation

competitive hourly rate based on experience and performance.



How to apply

Apply with your CV and answer these two questions:



which CRM have you managed most, and what did you improve inside it?



describe a data-cleaning project you handled and how you ensured accuracy.



Job type: full-time

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work location: remote

Benefits: work from home

title: Website Sales Lead Generation Rep
description:
Are you tired of campaign-based work that ends every few months or maybe after 1 year?

•Would you like to work at a company with advancement opportunities where you can spend your whole career?

•Do you want to work at a supportive company with a friendly, family culture?

•Do you want to be able to work overtime (but not have it required)?

•Do you want to work for a company where Filipinos are not considered to be outsiders?

•Do you want to work somewhere with no danger they ever ask you to work in person?



Then this is your opportunity.



We build beautiful websites for small businesses across the United States and Canada. Our amazing team of 110 associates has produced incredible results:



We have grown 30%+ each year for the last 8 years.



We have over 2,000 5-star reviews.



100% of our managers and team leads started in entry-level positions with our company.



APPLY HERE: 



Job Description:

You will make outbound calls to small business owners using a dialing platform.

You will offer our website services to potential clients.

You may answer inbound calls from potential clients, scheduling them for appointments to speak to a web designer.



What we offer:

Base pay Php 6,350 per week plus night differential (=Php 7,000/wk.)

Weekly incentive pay

Monthly attendance bonus

Monthly technology allowance

Pay is received every Friday

Very stable work

Permanent position (not just a contract)

Overtime is always available (but not required)

Ability to work from home

Respectful, encouraging work culture

Opportunity to grow with the company



APPLY HERE: 



We are looking for friendly, professional people with strong English language skills to join our team. We are looking for:

Excellent English language skills, both verbal and written

Experience with appointment setting OR equivalent outbound calling experience

Ability to work from home (Must have good internet access, a computer, and a headset.)

A history of great teamwork

Strong customer-handling skills

Able to work during USA business hours from 7:45 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time with overtime (7:45 p.m. to 4 a.m. Manila Time) Monday through Friday, along with an optional OT that runs through 5:00 a.m. Eastern Standard Time.



This is a permanent work-from-home position. Our workflow is extremely stable.



We are a Christian-led business. You will hear a lot about our faith when you work here. We have adopted 8 orphanages in the Philippines with 164 orphans. None of these kids has a birthday that someone on our staff isn't there to celebrate. We reimburse Financial Peace classes, and some employees meet for a Bible study on the clock. You won't have to participate in any of this, but you can. You don't have to be a Christian to work here.



APPLY HERE:

title: Administrative Agent
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025 and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job. 

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience. 

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you. 

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM 

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here. 





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed. 

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system. 

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link:

title: AI Image Generation VA
description:
We are rapidly growing our creative team and are looking for a highly skilled AI Image Generation Specialist (Virtual Assistant) to join us!



This specific role is dedicated to the art and science of AI-driven imagery.



We need someone who doesn't just write “make me a good image for an ad” and hits enter hoping for the best. 



We are looking for someone who understands how to prompt and manipulate AI tools to get high-quality, consistent, and stunning results. 



You will be the go-to person for generating the visual assets that our editors and marketing team need to make our content stand out. This is a remote, long-term partnership with a focus on speed, quality, and creative flair.



Hours: 40 hours a week



Responsibilities



As our Image Generation Specialist, you will be responsible for:



• Prompt Engineering: Creating and refining complex prompts to generate specific visual styles and characters.

• Batch Generation: Producing a high volume of images based on creative briefs for our video editors.

• Quality Control: Upscaling images, fixing "AI artifacts" (like hands or distorted faces), and ensuring all outputs meet our brand standards.

• Style Consistency: Maintaining a consistent look and feel across different sets of images.

• Organization: Follow Naming conventions and uploading files to our shared drives (Google Drive) so the team can find them ASAP.

• Reporting: Checking in daily with the Creative Strategist to sync on the week's priorities.

• Tools you will use: Midjourney (primary), DALL-E 3, Stable Diffusion, and basic Photoshop/Canva for touch-ups.



This is NOT a position for:



People who are brand new to AI tools or haven’t used them for work before.

People who cannot follow strict deadlines or respond quickly during work hours.



The ideal candidate has:



• Proven Experience: A portfolio of your best AI generated images using a variety of tools (THIS IS A MUST)

• Technical Knowledge: Proficiency in a variety of Tools like Midjourney, NanoBanana Pro, Adobe FireFly, Canva Pro, Leonardo and any other that would help you achieve the best results.

• Detail-Oriented: You notice the small errors in AI images that others miss and proactively fix them without much guidance.

• Communication: Fluent English and Spanish both for team communication and for the images needed



What We Can Offer You



100% Remote: Work from anywhere in the world.

Cutting-Edge Work: Get paid to play with the latest AI technology.

Flexible Schedule: As long as the assets are delivered on time and you have fluent timely communication with the team, you manage your own time.

Fast-Paced Environment: you’ll have a constant flow of work on a variety of fresh projects.



To Apply



Please submit your application via this link [We’ll only review applications that come through this link]:

title: SEO Expert | WordPress & Elementor Pro Specialist
description:
Timezone for this role: CST Business Hours



You must be confident in doing a live task as part of the application process.



Essential Functions (What you’ll do)



A) Elementor Migration (Initial Project)

Convert legacy WordPress pages (Classic Editor/HTML) into Elementor using brand-consistent

templates and global styles (headers, footers, typography, color tokens).

Rebuild pages with on-page SEO best practices: keyword-mapped H1/H2 structure, internal links, optimized media/alt text, schema, and clean slugs/meta.

Implement technical hygiene during migration: 301 redirects, canonical tags, updated sitemaps, no-index where appropriate, and fix orphan pages.and pass Core Web Vitals on key templates.



B) Ongoing SEO Operations & Site Health

Ensure performance: compress/resize images, lazy load media, minimize render-blocking assets,

Run SEMrush audits; prioritize & resolve errors/warnings/notice queues on a weekly cadence.

Monitor Google Search Console (coverage, indexing, enhancements, sitemap health, manual

actions) and fix issues quickly.

Track GA4 essentials: organic sessions, landing pages, conversions, geo trends; surface insights to the team.

Maintain on-page SEO: update titles/meta, add internal links, refresh stale content, and create/update FAQ schema where 
sign/SEO/accessibility, and follow our SOP checklists.

title: Efficient Video Editor & Publishing Assistant
description:
Hi there,



I'm still looking for a talented and passionate video editor to assist me with my growing YouTube channel and video publishing on Substack. 



IMPORTANT *** I require a quick turnaround time and professional communication, ideally you cannot be a college student and must own a computer (no editing on mobile devices with Capcut.). You need to be working with Da Vinci Resolve, or Premier Pro or some other professional software.



The audio in my footage must be put through an AI audio enhancement tool like ADOBE PODCAST enhancer.



Please post direct links to your editing samples, applications without links to a portfolio will be deleted and ignored, thank you ????



About the job and style:



My content is primarily centered around helping people deeply connect to themselves in life and business, if you are passionate about self help, development, uncovering the hidden mysteries of life and spirituality, then this will be a job you deeply enjoy.



I currently do all my own video editing but I am looking to hand this off to someone so I can purely focus on recording and writing and thumbnails and have someone else do the editing.



The style of editing I am going for is very simple, as I am mostly aiming for retention, here is an example of one of my recent videos: youtu.be/fk7ESh2hQlo



You will need to do the following:



1. Download the raw video fro
 on Google Drive.

2. Review my notes for what needs to be cut, and for where to put specific titles

3. Do the basic edits and cuts

4. Upload the video to YouTube (without publishing)

5. If any revisions need to be made, we come back to revisions.

6. Upload the finished final to YouTube and Substack





The style as you see is very basic.



- No to minimal stock (saves lots of time)

- Basic cuts.

- Slide out titles and occassional full screen progress bar as I move through certain points.

- "Zoom In" used sparingly in key spots to make certain key points pop.



This is an easy job for someone who knows what they're doing, likes the subject matter and can use the extra cash.



This is a part time job, I usually have
minute videos per week.



It is okay if you have other commitments but I would require a turn around time within 24 - 48 hours or please let me know if it will take longer.



Thank you so much and looking forward to meet you!

title: Klaviyo Tech/Engineer
description:
Start Project-Based, Grow Into Full-Time



We're a boutique retention agency working with fast-growing DTC ecommerce brands. We're looking for a Klaviyo Technical Specialist who doesn't just "know" Klaviyo — you live inside it. If you've built flows that actually drive revenue (not just exist in an account collecting dust), keep reading.



What You'll Be Working On



- Building and maintaining complex automated flows (welcome series, abandoned cart, post-purchase, winbacks, and beyond)

- Shopify-Klaviyo integrations — custom events, data mapping, tracking setup

- Advanced segmentation based on customer behavior, purchase history, and predictive analytics

- HTML/CSS
 development and QA across devices and clients

- Account audits — diagnosing broken flows, data discrepancies, and deliverability issues

- Conversion tracking setup and attribution maintenance



Who We're Looking For



You're a Klaviyo technician who thinks in conditional splits and trigger filters. You don't just drag and drop — you understand why a flow is structured a certain way and what happens to the data at every step. When something breaks, you find it before anyone notices.



You Must Have:



Experience & Knowledge:



- 1–3+ years of hands-on experience directly managing the Klaviyo platform (not just "helped with
s" — you owned the account)

- Proven track record building and troubleshooting complex flow logic

- Strong understanding of Shopify data structure (customer data, product catalogs, order events)



Technical Skills:



- HTML/CSS proficiency for
 template troubleshooting and development

- Ability to diagnose API errors, broken integrations, and data mapping issues

- High attention to detail — you can QC complex conditional logic without letting things slip through

- Understanding of deliverability fundamentals and list hygiene best practices



Bonus Points:



- Experience with other ESPs (Mailchimp, Attentive, etc.)

- Familiarity with PM tools (Asana, Slack)

- Understanding of SQL or API documentation

- Experience working agency-side with multiple client accounts



The Setup



We're starting on a project basis to see how we work together. Deliver clean, reliable technical work? This becomes a full-time position with consistent work across our client portfolio.



You'll be working directly with our strategy team, turning retention strategies into technically bulletproof execution. We move fast, we test constantly, and we don't tolerate sloppy builds.



How To Apply



Fill out the application form below with:



- Examples of Klaviyo accounts or flows you've built (screenshots, case studies, or walkthroughs welcome)

- Your experience level with Shopify integrations

- Tools and platforms you're proficient in

- Your rate and availability



ADDITIONALLY - Apply to this form as well or you will not be considered for this role: 
 



NOTE: Do not use AI to fill out this form or we will immediately disqualify your application.

title: From the revised job post, the title is: B2B Outreach & Qualification Virtual Assistant — Private Clinics
description:
B2B Outreach & Qualification

Virtual Assistant — Private Clinics

England, Scotland, Wales & Ireland  |  Part-Time, Remote  |  Growth Role



About the Role

We are looking for a structured and professional Virtual Assistant to support outreach to private appointment-based clinics across England, Scotland, Wales, and Ireland.



We operate VioConcierge — an AI-powered appointment confirmation system that reduces no-shows and significantly cuts manual admin workload for clinics. The system is positioned as a premium implementation, not a commodity product.



Clinics do not purchase immediately. Instead, qualified clinics enter through our 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience — a structured onboarding phase where VioConcierge is implemented and performance is measured in real time. After this experience, suitable clinics transition to the full monthly system.



Your responsibility is to identify and qualify clinics for entry into this experience. You are the first point of contact and the gatekeeper for the programme.



“This is a structured outreach and qualification role. Not a closing role.”



What You Will Be Doing

Your day-to-day will involve a focused set of outreach and qualification activities:

Researching private clinics (dental, aesthetics, physio, medical, and similar)

Sending personalised LinkedIn and
 outreach messages

Opening professional conversations with clinic owners and practice managers

Asking structured qualification questions to assess fit

Inviting suitable clinics to complete our application form

Updating a weekly KPI tracker accurately and consistently

Submitting a weekly performance summary



This Is Not a Sales Closing Role

It is important to be clear about what this role does not involve. All commercial discussions happen internally once a clinic has been qualified through you.



You will not:

Discuss pricing or payment terms

Negotiate plans or packages

Close sales or make commercial promises

Guarantee outcomes to prospects



What You Will Be Explaining to Clinics

To qualify leads effectively, you will need a solid understanding of what VioConcierge delivers. The key facts you will be communicating are:



The 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience is completely free of charge.



There is no setup cost, no subscription commitment, and no obligation during the 21 days. The clinic receives everything — including VioConcierge credits — at no cost. This is a genuine, risk-free experience, not a trial with hidden conditions.



During the 21 days, participating clinics:

Implement the VioConcierge system within their existing workflows

See measurable reductions in appointment no-shows

Reduce time spent on manual confirmation calls and follow-ups

Improve consistency of patient communication

Receive a structured performance report at the end of the 21 days



Clinics that wish to continue after the 21 days move onto the full VioConcierge monthly system, which involves a setup fee and monthly subscription. That conversation happens entirely with us — not with you. Your role ends at the application.



The experience is selective. We do not invite every clinic that enquires. Part of your role is to ensure only genuinely suitable clinics progress to application.



Compensation Structure

This role pays a fixed USD $500 per month, structured as a base availability fee plus a performance component. There is no ambiguity about what you earn or why.



Monthly Retainer — USD $500 total

The retainer has two components:



Base Availability Fee: USD $350 per month — paid unconditionally each month, provided you are available for required hours and submit your weekly KPI reports.

Performance Component: up to USD $150 per month — paid in full or in part based on your verified application count for that month.



Performance tiers for the monthly component:



Note: In your first calendar month, the full $150 performance component is paid regardless of application count. This gives you time to establish your outreach rhythm before tiers apply.



Additional Earnings

USD $5.00 per verified application — every confirmed, qualified application earns you $5 on top of the retainer, paid monthly.

USD $25.00 conversion bonus — paid each time a clinic you sourced completes the 21-day experience and subscribes to the full VioConcierge system.



What You Could Realistically Earn

A VA consistently hitting mid-range targets — around 20 verified applications per month and one conversion — earns:



$500 retainer (full performance component unlocked)

$100 in application fees (20 apps × $5)

$25 conversion bonus

Total: approximately $625 USD per month, part-time



At strong performance — 30 applications and two conversions — total monthly earnings reach approximately $700 USD. Every metric above the floor goes directly into your pocket.



Compensation will increase with performance and as the role scales.



Performance Expectations — Month 1

We measure quality and targeting over raw volume. Week-on-week improvement matters more than hitting every number from day one.



Weekly targets:

200–300 personalised outreach messages

20–40 replies

5–10 completed applications



Growth Opportunity

This role begins focused on private clinics across England, Scotland, Wales, and Ireland. As performance metrics are proven and the system scales, there is a clear pathway to grow into:

Senior Sales Development role

Territory Expansion Lead

Revenue-based compensation structure

Full-time revenue position



We build for the long term and strongly prefer to promote from within.



Who We Are Looking For

You must have:

Excellent written professional English

Comfort with structured B2B outreach processes

The discipline to follow scripts and qualification frameworks precisely

Strong KPI tracking habits and consistent weekly reporting

Availability to overlap at least 2–3 hours with UK business hours



Preferred:

Previous B2B outreach or SDR experience

LinkedIn outreach experience

Experience targeting healthcare, dental, or clinic businesses



This role is not suited to high-volume automation approaches, mass broadcasting tools, or commission-only closers. We represent a premium implementation experience and expect our outreach to reflect that standard.



Tone Standard

All outreach on behalf of VioConcierge should feel professional, direct, and respectful of the clinic owner’s time. We are not selling a software subscription — we are inviting a select group of clinics into a structured programme that costs them nothing to experience.



The 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience is completely free of charge to the clinic. There is no obligation, no setup cost during the 21 days, and no commitment required. This is a genuine, no-risk offer — and your outreach should communicate that clearly without overselling it.



An example of the register we expect:



“Hi [Name], I work with a small number of private clinics on a structured 21-day implementation that reduces appointment no-shows — at no cost to the practice. We’re selective about who we invite. Would a brief conversation make sense?”



Note the phrasing: “at no cost to the practice” rather than “free.” The offer is identical, but the language preserves the premium positioning. Clinic owners have seen free trials. They have not been selectively invited to a no-cost structured implementation. That distinction matters and should come through in how you write.



Short. Specific. No pressure. This is the standard your outreach should meet.



How to Apply

To apply, please answer all of the following questions. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Important: Begin your application with the word “Structured” to confirm you have read this post in full.



Write a short LinkedIn message introducing the 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience to a private dental clinic owner. (This is the most important part of your application.)

Describe your B2B outreach experience — sectors, tools used, and typical volumes.

How would you identify and research private dental clinics in England?

Confirm your expected monthly salary in USD.

Confirm your weekly availability and your overlap with UK business hours.



VioConcierge is a product of Smart AI Solutions. We are building something long-term and are selective about who joins the team.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Accountant / Bookkeeper for Comprehensive Financial Support



Job Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Accountant / Bookkeeper to provide comprehensive support across various financial domains in our company. This remote, freelance position requires expertise in handling Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable and reconciliation.



The ideal candidate will be proactive, efficient, and committed to timely and accurate financial reporting and management.



Responsibilities:



- Accounts Payable (AP): Assist with invoice processing, ensure timely payments, and work on maximizing cash flow efficiencies. Manage vendor relationships and handle any disputes or issues to maintain positive engagements.



- Accounts Receivable (AR): Support the billing and collections processes to ensure they are optimized for faster cash cycles. Handle customer queries and ensure clear and transparent communication to strengthen customer relations.



- Record to Report (R2R): Help maintain accurate records of all financial transactions and ensure compliance with accounting standards and legal requirements. Support the generation of reports that offer insights into the financial health of the business.



- Payroll Management: Assist in processing payroll accurately and on time, adhering to all tax regulations and internal policies.



Required Skills and Qualifications:

- Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

- Proven bookkeeping experience, with a strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.

- Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.

- Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

- Effective communication skills, capable of handling interactions with tea
mbers and external partners.



Additional Information:

- Candidates should include a detailed resume and a brief cover letter outlining relevant experience and qualifications.

Requirements

title: Product Manager – Inventory & Supplier Operations (Part-Time | Long-Term)
description:
Hi there!



My name is Nick Karselius, I’m 17 years old and the founder of a fast-growing e-commerce company in the Netherlands.

We sell on 
 (the Dutch version of Amazon) and have been scaling rapidly:



• 4 months ago: €18,000 revenue/month

• Now: €40,000+ revenue/month



We’ve more than doubled in just 3 months — and we’re only getting started!



I’ve been running this business for 3 years with a strong and dedicated international VA team of 12 amazing people (11 from the Philippines).

We’re growing fast, we reward hard work, and we’re looking for new A-players to grow with us.



What You’ll Do



This role is about keeping our product inventory accurate and suppliers organized.

You’ll make sure we always know which products are in stock, where we can buy them, and that orders are placed correctly with our suppliers.



Your main responsibilities:



• Check stock on TEMU for all our products (currently 11,000+) once per month and mark out-of-stock items.

• Check bestsellers weekly — make sure our top-selling items are always available.

• Place orders with suppliers after a customer orders from us (dropshipping model).

• Find alternatives when a product is out of stock or when better suppliers exist.

• Communicate with suppliers to confirm stock, prices, and replacements.

• Track data in Google Sheets — keep records of supplier links, inventory status, and product performance.

• Think ahead — help us find ways to store small stock or improve our sourcing flow.



Who We’re Looking For



• Organized, reliable, and proactive — you take initiative and don’t wait to be told.

• Basic experience with e-commerce or dropshipping (TEMU, AliExpress, etc.) is a plus.

• Strong written English communication skills.

• Comfortable with Google Sheets (you’ll use it daily).

• Part-time availability — around 15 hours per week.

• Detail-oriented and focused — accuracy is key.



You don’t need years of experience. We’ll guide you step-by-step through our process.



Compensation



• Base pay: $1.00 per hour

• Bonuses: You can earn $50–$60 extra per month for good performance (accuracy, reliability, and consistency).

• Long-term position with opportunities to grow as our inventory and supplier network expand.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us



• You’ll work directly with a young, ambitious founder who cares about your growth.

• You’ll be part of a supportive, international team that values communication and results.

• You’ll learn how real e-commerce businesses operate at scale — with thousands of products.

• Flexible hours and long-term stability.



We don’t just hire people; we invest in people who want to grow.



How to Apply



To be considered for this position, you must complete the short application form below:





Please make sure to include the secret word “inventory” in your answers — it’s how we know you read the full job post carefully.



Once you’ve submitted the form, we’ll review your application and contact you if you’re selected for the next step.



We’re excited to meet you — and hopefully welcome you to the team!

description:

________________________________________

Growth Structure of the Role

 Management

s

Responsibilities

s

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: P&C Virtual Asssistant
description:
Are you an experienced insurance professional with a strong background in client phone support and personal lines policy servicing within a Massachusetts-based agency? We are seeking a full-time Virtual Assistant to support our Personal Lines Property & Casualty team.



This role is ideal for someone who excels in handling inbound and outbound client calls, enjoys assisting customers with policy-related requests, and understands the servicing side of insurance operations.



Position Details

Job Type: Full-Time

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST

Hours: 40 hours per week

Pay: Bi-weekly

Time Off: 10 PTO days per year



Key Responsibilities (Phone Support & Policy Servicing Focus)



Serve as the primary point of contact for client phone inquiries

Handle inbound and outbound calls regarding coverage questions, billing concerns, endorsements, and general policy servicing

Assist clients with policy changes such as adding or removing vehicles, updating drivers, address changes, coverage adjustments, and documentation requests

Provide clear explanations of coverage options and policy details

Process endorsements and service requests accurately and efficiently

Communicate with insurance carriers to resolve client issues

Document all client interactions thoroughly in the CRM or agency management system

Follow up on open service requests to ensure timely resolution

Maintain professionalism and compliance while delivering exceptional customer service



What We’re Looking For:



Proven experience in personal lines insurance servicing or customer phone support.

Strong comfort level handling high call volumes

Excellent verbal communication and active listening skills

Ability to explain coverage details clearly and confidently

Detail-oriented with strong documentation habits

Experience with CRM or agency management systems

Highly organized and able to manage multiple service requests simultaneously

Self-motivated and capable of working independently in a remote environment



How to Apply

Qualified candidates only.

Please submit your application with the subject line:



**HAPPINESS**

Include a Loom video answering the following:

Tell us about yourself (interests, hobbies, etc.)

If you are passionate about client communication, phone-based support, and delivering outstanding policy servicing within a fast-paced insurance agency, we would love to hear from you.

title: SEO SPECIALIST (WITH AI SEO EXPERIENCE)
description:
Overview

We are seeking a results-driven SEO Specialist with strong expertise across technical SEO, on-page optimization, content strategy and link building. This role will be responsible for driving organic growth, improving paid campaign performance, and strengthening the overall authority and visibility of our digital presence across search engines.



The ideal candidate combines technical expertise, creative content strategy, and analytical acumen, ensuring that both organic and paid efforts align with broader business objectives.





Key Responsibilities

1. Technical SEO + AI SEO

• Conduct comprehensive website audits to identify and resolve crawl, indexation, and site structure issues.

• Optimize Core Web Vitals, mobile performance, and overall site speed.

• Implement and maintain robots.txt, XML sitemaps, and canonical tags for proper indexation.

• Collaborate with web developers on schema markup, internal linking, and URL architecture improvements.

• Manage redirects, site migrations, and ensure minimal ranking impact post-deployment.

• Monitor and maintain search engine visibility, fixing crawl errors and monitoring coverage in Google Search Console.

• Support international SEO and multi-language site optimization where required.





2. On-Page SEO

• Conduct detailed keyword research and mapping for all priority pages.

• Optimize meta titles, descriptions, headings, and image alt text for target keywords.

• Ensure content is aligned with search intent, keyword clusters, and user engagement best practices.

• Audit and enhance internal linking structure for optimal equity flow and crawl depth.

• Conduct competitor benchmarking to identify new ranking opportunities.

• Collaborate with UX/design teams to improve landing page performance and conversions.





3. Content Strategy & Writing

• Plan, write, and edit SEO-optimized content for blogs, service pages, guides, and landing pages.

• Conduct topic and content gap analysis to expand keyword coverage and topical authority.

• Ensure all content adheres to E-E-A-T and brand voice standards.

• Collaborate with copywriters, designers, and videographers to produce high-performing content assets.

• Use performance data to optimize and refresh existing content for improved rankings and engagement.





4. Link Building & Outreach

• Develop and execute a comprehensive link-building strategy to improve domain authority and page authority.

• Identify and pursue high-quality backlink opportunities through guest posting, partnerships, digital PR, and content promotion.

• Conduct backlink audits using tools such as Ahrefs or SEMrush to identify toxic or low-quality links.

• Manage outreach campaigns to bloggers, journalists, and industry websites to secure relevant backlinks.

• Monitor anchor text distribution, backlink growth, and link quality over time.

• Collaborate with the content team to create linkable assets (e.g., infographics, research reports, case studies).







6. Analytics & Reporting

• Track organic and paid performance through Google Analytics (GA4), Google Ads, Search Console, and Looker Studio dashboards.

• Generate detailed monthly and quarterly reports with actionable insights.

• Monitor keyword movements, traffic trends, bounce rates, and conversion data.

• Evaluate the impact of SEO and SEM initiatives on overall business KPIs.

• Stay current with Google algorithm updates and implement best practices proactively.





Qualifications & Skills

• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, IT, or a related discipline.

• 3+ years of experience in SEO (technical, on-page, content, link building) + AI SEO EXPERIENCE

• Proven track record improving organic traffic, keyword rankings, and domain authority.

• Demonstrated success managing Google Ads and Bing Ads campaigns with measurable ROI.

• Strong content writing and editing skills, with the ability to craft engaging, SEO-optimized content.

• Proficiency with industry tools: Google Analytics (GA4), Search Console, Google Ads, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz, Screaming Frog, and PageSpeed Insights.

• Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals.

• Familiarity with CMS platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, or HubSpot.

• Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and collaboration skills.

• Strong project management and time management capabilities.





Why Join Us

• Collaborative, data-driven digital marketing environment.

• Opportunity to work on diverse, high-impact SEO & SEM campaigns.

• Access to premium marketing tools and training resources.

• Competitive salary and bonus structure based on performance.

• Career growth in a fast-evolving digital team.

• International Trips for client meetings



START DATE: FEB 2026

TYPE: FULL TIME

DAYSHIFT - MELBOURNE TIME

title: Full-Time Product Lister (45 hrs/week) – $1/hr + Monthly Sales Bonuses up to $100+
description:
Hi there!



My name is Nick Karselius, I’m 17 years old and run a fast-growing e-commerce company in the Netherlands.

We sell on Bol (the Dutch version of Amazon), and we’re scaling fast.



Just a few months ago, our monthly revenue was around €18,000.

Now our top month is already over €55,000, and we’re still growing every single week.



We currently have 9 people in the team (all from the Philippines), and now we’re looking for new Product Listers to join us full-time.



What You’ll Do



As a Product Lister, you’ll help us grow by uploading new products to our stores.



You’ll be doing things like:

• Finding and preparing products from Amazon

• Uploading them through our DSers Shopify  BaseLinker workflow

• Adjusting product titles, descriptions, and details

• Publishing products live on Bol

• Tracking your uploads in our shared team sheet



You don’t need experience, we teach you everything step by step.

All you need is a great attitude and willingness to learn, everything else can be learned easily.



What We Offer



• $1/hr starting rate

• Monthly bonuses up to $100+, based on:

• Your performance

• How well your products sell, you get a small share of the profit per product!

• A friendly, supportive team, 9 of your teammates are from the Philippines

• Opportunities to grow, the best people can become team leaders

• A positive culture, where hard work and learning are rewarded



How It Works



Once you’ve filled out the form, here’s what happens next:



Application review: We’ll read your answers and see if you’re a good fit.



Trial week: You’ll complete a test assignment (around 10–15 hours, over 3 days)



We do this to see how motivated and consistent you are before joining full-time.



Why You’ll Love Working Here



• A fun, motivated team where everyone helps each other

• Always a Filipino contact person available for support

• You’ll learn everything, no experience needed

• Fast company growth, fast personal growth

• You’ll actually see your impact, better listings mean more sales and more bonuses

• You’ll be part of something that’s growing every single week



How to Apply



To apply, fill out this short form:

https://forms.gle/JXb4xrEro6Z43z2V6



Include the secret word “printer” to show that you read this job post carefully.

If we think you’re a great fit, we’ll message you about the trial week.



Team Testimonial



“My name is Antonio, one of Nick's Product Pusher. I was amazed to earn a $120 bonus almost every month from the sales of the products I've listed on our store! It’s proof that attention to detail and creativity really pay off. You can even earn more and it is always there once your products starts selling. If you’re thinking about applying—go for it, your effort can truly turn into rewarding results!”

– Antonio



If you’re hungry to learn, ready to grow, and willing to give consistent effort, this job is for you.

We don’t care about degrees or experience, we care about mindset.



Apply now through the form and let’s grow together.



Nick Karselius

Founder – Quore B.V.

Compensation & Perks

You Are The One If:

????? HOW TO APPLY (The "Enthusiast Filter")

Subject Line: Change to: "Piyesa Hub Ops | [Your Niche/Specialty] | [Your City]"



The Intro: Tell me: What is the most common fitment issue people face with Carbon Fiber parts for your favorite car model?
