title: Need Video Ads & Image Ads Editor (E-commerce)
description:
Role Summary:

This is a hands-on Ads Editor role focused on the daily production of high-performing 

video and image ads.

The role is execution-first, with light creative input on hooks, angles, and ad structure - within clear SOPs and guidelines if needed.



About Us:

We are Sweden-based e-commerce company operating multiple Shopify stores in fast-paced Dropshipping. We work internationally, launch and scale multiple brands, and focus on real performance results with 7-figure annual revenue.



We’re looking for a Video ads & Image ads Editor with strong performance intuition. You know how to turn UGC clips, b-roll, product footage, images, and AI-generated assets into scroll-stopping ads that convert. This is a hands-on, execution-focused role where you’ll mainly edit ads while contributing light creative input on hooks, angles, and structure — within clear SOPs and guidelines if needed. If you understand e-commerce advertising psychology and like working within structured systems, this role is for you.



Required Skills:

• Fluent English (written & spoken)

• Proven experience editing paid social ads (video & image)

• Strong understanding of winning ad psychology

• Up-to-date with social media ad formats & trends

• Experience with Premiere Pro / CapCut (or similar editing program) + photo editing software

• Comfortable working with Google Drive, ChatGPT and follow task-based format

•  Able to follow SOPs and structured processes consistently



Your Responsibilities:

• Edit short-form video & image ads (UGC-style, product ads, campaign creatives)

• Add overlays, AI voiceovers (tools provided) , captions, and effects to maximize retention

• Assist with light script creation using ChatGPT and internal frameworks

• Assist with sourcing materials when needed (UGC, b-roll, product footage, references)

• Follow SOPs, active tasks given, naming conventions, and folder structures



Most edits are short-form (30-60 seconds) and follow existing structures and templates. You can expect 3–10 ad edits per day, depending on format, length and complexity.



Role Details:

Type: Long-term position (not short-term freelance)

Hours: Part-time: 20 hrs/week (first month) then Full-time: 40 hrs/week (after trial period)



Salary:

• $350 USD / month (part-time)

($4.04 USD/hr)

Why You’ll Like This Role:

title: Operations and Executive Support Assistant - Short Term Rental | Property Management
description:
Full-Time | Property Management | Long-Term Role | Systems and Operations



I’m hiring one full-time STR Operations and Executive Support Virtual Assistant to help build and own the operational backbone of the company while also taking full responsibility for the day-to-day execution that keeps our Airbnb portfolio running smoothly.



This role combines property management operations with broader operations management responsibilities, executive assistant-level support, systems development, workflow documentation, and process improvement. 



You will support Soletta Villas’ growing portfolio of short-term rental properties in the United States and Bonaire (Dutch Caribbean), including both full-service property management and co-host properties. We are a mission-driven vacation rental and short term rental (STR) property management company focused on operational excellence, exceptional guest hospitality, and building scalable systems.



You will work directly with the founder and take ownership of guest communication, vendor coordination, inbox and calendar management, SOP creation, task prioritization, and operational reporting. 



The goal of this position is simple:



Build dependable processes and run operations smoothly so the founder can focus on growth and client acquisition.



If you thrive on creating order, improving systems, implementing automation, and delivering outstanding guest service — and you’re equally comfortable with structured systems work and daily execution — keep reading.





WHAT YOU WILL OWN



GUEST COMMUNICATION & HOSPITALITY

 - Monitor and respond to all guest messages across Airbnb and other platforms during assigned coverage hours

 - Maintain a 100% response rate during working hours

 - Respond to inquiries beyond automated messaging (Hospitable manages routine automations)

 - Resolve guest concerns independently whenever possible

 - Escalate complex or time-sensitive issues appropriately and without delay

 - Ensure all guest communication reflects professionalism, warmth, and exceptional customer service

 - Draft and post review responses

 - Identify recurring guest issues and propose system improvements



VENDOR & OPERATIONAL COORDINATION

 - Coordinate with cleaners regarding turnover schedules and special instructions

 - Communicate clearly and proactively with maintenance vendors

 - Track open issues through full resolution and maintain status visibility

 - Ensure vendor payments are processed accurately and promptly

 - Maintain an organized and current vendor database

 - Support onboarding of new properties into operational systems



SYSTEMS, SOP, AND AUTOMATION OWNERSHIP

 - Build and maintain the company’s operational SOP library

 - Document repeatable workflows clearly and logically (written and Loom-based when appropriate)

 - Identify operational gaps and proactively design systems to address them

 - Maintain structured, scalable Google Drive organization

 - Establish and enforce file naming conventions

 - Keep digital records organized, consistent, and audit-ready

 - Identify and implement automation opportunities across PMS, CRM, and workflow systems



TIME TRACKING & OPERATIONAL REPORTING

 - Track time daily and accurately across properties and internal projects

 - Categorize time clearly as assigned

 - Maintain integrity, consistency, and clarity in reporting

 - Provide weekly operational summaries outlining progress, issues, and next priorities



LISTING OPTIMIZATION, REVENUE MANAGEMENT & GROWTH SUPPORT

 - Support listing updates and optimization initiatives

 - Research rental comps and occupancy trends

 - Prepare revenue management analysis to support pricing discussions

 - Prepare materials for prospective management clients

 - Research and organize potential management opportunities

 - Maintain accurate prospect tracking systems (CRM)

 - Support systems integration for new client onboarding



FOUNDER SUPPORT & EXECUTIVE OPERATIONS

 - Support the founder’s operational communications and inbox organization

 - Coordinate and maintain the founder’s operational calendar

 - Draft internal and external communications as needed

 - Track follow-ups and ensure commitments are executed

 - Proactively identify items that can be handled independently versus escalated





PERFORMANCE & ACCOUNTABILITY



This is a high-ownership role with measurable expectations.



Success in this position will be evaluated through responsiveness, reliability, quality of communication, systems development, automation implementation, and consistency of execution.



Structured feedback and performance reviews will take place at 30 and 90 days to assess progress and long-term fit.





REQUIREMENTS

TECHNICAL & OPERATIONAL

 - Strong professional written English

 - Reliable high-speed internet connection

 - Experience working across multiple digital platforms including Google Workspace (especially Google Sheets) and WhatsApp

 - Comfortable learning new systems quickly and independently

 - Strong independent problem-solving ability

 - Systems-oriented mindset with ability to create structure and organization

 - Interest in automation and process optimizations 

 - Accurate, transparent, and ethical time tracking habits



PREFERRED

 - Experience with OTAs such as Airbnb, VRBO, Booking dot com, and direct booking platforms

 - Experience with Property Management Systems (PMS) such as Hospitable, OwnerRez, Guesty, Lodgify, or similar

 - Experience with revenue management tools such as PriceLabs

 - Experience with CRM systems such as GoHighLevel or MarketMySTR

 - Experience with project management tools such as Monday dot com, Asana, or Notion

 - Experience using AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Zapier, or Perplexity



MINDSET & PROFESSIONAL TRAITS

 - Takes responsibility for outcomes, not just assigned tasks

 - Improvement-oriented mindset (“How can this be better?”)

 - Structured, detail-oriented, and process-driven

 - Calm and decisive under pressure

 - Independent executor who communicates clearly and proactively

 - Comfortable providing direct, professional communication to vendors and stakeholders when needed

 - Interested in a long-term role with opportunity to grow as the company scales





SCHEDULE & STRUCTURE

 - 35–40 hours per week on a consistent weekly schedule

 - Independent contractor position

 - Minimum 1 hour daily overlap with Atlantic Standard Time (AST)

 - Long-term role — not a short-term or project-based position

 - Occasional schedule flexibility during high-volume periods preferred



COMPENSATION

 - $4-7/hour depending on experience and demonstrated ability.

 - Performance-based raises possible after 90 days and annually thereafter.





HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)



To apply, please send an
 to 
 the subject line: STR Operations VA Application



Include: 

 - A current CV or resume 

 - Examples of your previous work relevant to this role

title: Virtual Assistant | Appointment Setter (Part-time)
description:
Title: Virtual Assistant | Appointment Setter (Part-Time, potential to become full-time)

Job Pay: $50/week ($200/month) – paid weekly

Company: Season’s Cleanings



About the Role: Season’s Cleanings is a fast-growing residential cleaning company, and we’re looking for ONE dependable, detail-loving STAR Virtual Assistant to join our core team for part-time support.



What does it mean to be a STAR Virtual Assistant?

S – Serve – Act in the best interest of the client.

T – Teammate – Act in the best interest of your teammates.

A – Accountable – Take responsibility for your actions.

R – Reliable – Follow through on your commitments.



Pay: $50/week with potential raises as the company grows!



Schedule:

Monday to Friday8am-9am CST and 4pm-7pm CST (split shift) Approximately 20 hours per week



If you enjoy working with leads, learning scripts, and supporting sales operations, this role is for you. You’ll play a key part in helping us book more appointments and grow the business.



Key Responsibilities:

Setting calls for inbound LSA (Local Service Ads)Handling outbound calls (hot
 leads)

Hopping on the phone with LSA messages to set up appointments for sales calls

Learning the setting script and becoming comfortable with it

Handling 3 lead sources and getting the sales calls booked in GHL (GoHighLevel) calendar

Ensuring the office is properly set up for the day without being reactive with sales calls or messages that come in from 8-9am

Ensuring calls are answered promptly







Requirements:

Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or in a phone/sales support role

Strong phone communication skills and comfortable making outbound calls

Excellent spoken English communication

Comfortable learning scripts and following processes

Able to work independently and stay focused during shift hours

Proficient in basic tools like calendars and CRM systems (GoHighLevel experience is a plus)

Reliable computer and strong, stable internet connectionA positive, proactive, “figure it out” attitude



Strict Requirements:

Must be available during the specified hours: 8am-9am CST and 4pm-7pm CST, Monday-Friday

We’re looking for someone who can take ownership of their work, learns quickly, and is excited to be part of a supportive, growing team—not just “another gig.”



Benefits:

Paid Time Off (after initial period)

PH Holiday Pay (for applicable holidays you work)

Revenue-Based Salary Increases & Incentives – As the company grows, your earning potential grows too



If you’re comfortable on the phone, love supporting sales operations, and want a stable part-time role with room to grow, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Remote Content Generation & SEO and AEO Link Building Assistant
description:
Summary

Remote Content Generation & SEO and AEO Link Building Assistant - Full Time and Long Term Contract



Are you interested in becoming a highly effective SEO professional focused on link building and content that earns links? Do you want to learn and grow personally, professionally, and financially? If so, this Remote SEO + AEO Link Building & Content Generation contract may be a fit.

We are a SaaS startup seeking a full-time, long-term contractor to help drive high revenue growth in 2026 and beyond by building authority through ethical link acquisition and linkable content creation.



Who You Are

Inspired: You have a strong desire to do great work and to grow.

Thoughtful: You understand how your work impacts the company and the world around you.

Skillful: You like working on the edge of your comfort zone. You embrace learning, iteration, and feedback.

Chill: You approach work with respect for peers, professionalism, and a healthy dose of fun.



What We’re Building

We are growing our organic acquisition engine by combining:

Content Generation: creating assets and outreach content that naturally attracts links (and supports placements like guest posts, partner content, and editorial mentions).

SEO link building: earning relevant, high-quality backlinks that improve authority and rankings.

AEO (Answer Engine Optimization): helping our content become quotable and discoverable in answer-driven search experiences (AI answers, featured snippets, “best answer” results) through structured, question-focused content and credible citations.

Other Marketing Campaigns:
 marketing, warm outreach, social media, cold outreach, and campaigns deemed helpful.



Required Skills & Traits

You likely fit if you have:

A strong desire to become an excellent SEO/AEO + link building professional and contribute directly to lead generation.

Comfort working in an entrepreneurial environment with weekly goals (and the drive to beat them).

Excellent writing skills (AI writing is not sufficient. You can write authentically with A’s help).

Strong research skills (you can evaluate sites, topics, and opportunities quickly).

Technology savvy + able to learn tools and systems fast.

High attention to detail and the ability to take tasks from start to completion.

Eagerness to learn and improve (highly trainable).

A 4-year Bachelor’s degree.

You are not associated with any agency in Upwork.

You can work with us in real time based on US CST.



Contract Responsibilities (After 2-Week Training) May Include

Content generation for link building

Creating and/or assisting with:

guest post drafts and outlines

linkable asset drafts (how-to guides, checklists, comparison pages, statistics roundups)

pitch angles, short summaries, and “snippet-ready” answer blocks

content refreshes that improve credibility, clarity, and quotability

Optimizing content structure to support SEO / AEO (clear question headings, concise answers, supporting evidence).

Write authentically, not generically, with AI.

SEO + AEO link building execution

Prospecting for relevant link opportunities (industry sites, resource pages, blogs, partners, directories where appropriate).

Running white-hat link building campaigns such as:

guest post / contributor placements (where appropriate)

resource page outreach

broken link building

unlinked mention reclamation

content promotion to earn editorial links

Conducting basic backlink and competitor research to identify “link gaps” and opportunities.

Supporting on-page SEO / AEO improvements that strengthen linkability (FAQ-style sections, direct answers, clear structure).

Outreach + relationship building

Writing, sending, and iterating outreach
s/DMs to secure placements and partnerships.

Following up consistently and professionally.

Building simple, repeatable processes to improve response and placement rates over time.

Reporting + operations support

Maintaining tracking spreadsheets/CRMs (prospects, outreach status, replies, wins, links live, URLs).

Producing daily/weekly/monthly reports with key metrics and learnings.

Supporting related marketing ops as needed.

Full-time commitment: at least 40 hours per week.



What You’ll Own After Training

We’ll equip you to master:

Content creation that earns links (and supports conversions)

Link building strategy + execution (ethical, repeatable, quality-focused)

SEO / AEO-friendly content structure (answer-first writing that supports modern search experiences)

Outreach systems (prospecting, pitching, follow-up, and relationship management)

Data-driven reporting (daily, weekly, monthly analytics and pipeline tracking)

Full-time ownership mindset: delivering weekly outcomes, not just completing tasks

Other Campaigns:
 marketing, warm outreach, social media, paid ads, cold outreach. You may manage others to run some of these campaigns.



Your Growth Path & Compensation

This position has strong long-term growth potential:

Trainee (Foundation Level): $7/hour minimum

Level 1 (Entry Professional): $8/hour minimum

Level 2 (Intermediate Specialist): $9/hour minimum

Level 3 (Advanced Specialist): $11/hour minimum

Level 4 (Master Marketer): $13/hour minimum

Level 5 (Authority Expert): $15/hour minimum



Extraordinary Benefits

Embracing AI technology in everything we do.

Managed by trusted and ethical professional managers.

Great training and development program.

Growth path: higher-level contract, more responsibilities, better pay.

Strong team support (including Recruiting/Training Manager and company President).

6 paid US National Holidays off (yes—paid holidays for contractors).

Paid personal time:

5 paid personal days accrued per year.



Our Culture & Values

You’ll thrive in an environment built on:

Genuine work-life harmony

Transparent, empathetic communication

Continuous professional development

Cutting-edge remote work tech

True team connection (no isolation)

Uncompromising integrity

Data-driven decisions (not ego-driven)



A Thorough Recruiting Process (Because This Role Is Critical)

We are not hiring a contractor. We are hiring a long-term partner who will help define our startup. Our process may include:

A survey

A work sample

Video interview

1st interview via Zoom

2nd interview via Zoom

Document review

This process reflects how important this contract is.

This is a positive, healthy, trust based environment.



We are looking for a smart, forward-thinking problem - solver to join our small crazy team! Or a

crazy small team. Works both ways actually!



Reminder: you should NOT apply if you are associated with an agency in Upwork. We only work with individual contractors.



Okay, we've said enough. Your turn :- )

title: Ad Creative Operations Manager
description:
We are looking to hire an Ad Creative Operations Manager for a fast-growing direct response ecommerce company in the health and beauty space (supplements, skincare, pain relief). The company is scaling aggressively, with a goal of reaching $5M in revenue and expanding into new markets this year.



This role is the operational backbone of the creative team. The founder is a strong CMO and strategist, but needs someone to build systems, track KPIs, and manage execution so he can focus on growth and strategy. If you enjoy building SOPs from scratch and bringing structure to fast-moving teams, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do

• Build and implement SOPs and KPIs across the creative team, including creative strategists, video editors, pineapples, and media buyers

• Manage the day-to-day operations of two creative teams, ensuring accountability, output quality, and deadlines are met

• Run tea
etings twice per week and daily check-ins focused on performance metrics such as CPL, ad spend, creative output, and win rates

• Identify bottlenecks in the creative pipeline and resolve them quickly

• Monitor creative performance and ensure the team is producing 15 to 30 ad creatives per day

• Ensure proper staffing across teams and flag hiring needs as the company scales

• Coordinate workflows between creative strategists, copywriters, video editors, and media buyers

• Report directly to the founder/CMO on team performance, blockers, and operational improvements



Must Haves

• Strong attention to details

• 5 to 7+ years of experience in a similar role within an agency or ecommerce environment

• Strong understanding of performance marketing, including media buying, CPL, ad spend, and creative testing frameworks

• Proven experience building SOPs and KPI structures for teams

• Experience managing and leading a team of 5 or more people

• Strong attention to details

• Highly organized, systematic thinker who can bring structure to chaos

• Strong English communication skills

• Able to work starting at 2:00 PM Philippine time



Nice To Haves

• Experience with TikTok and Meta ad platforms

• Understanding of cash-on-delivery business models

• Experience scaling creative output for direct response campaigns

• Familiarity with AI tools for content and creative production

• Experience with ClickUp or similar project management tools



Compensation, Benefits, and Logistics

• Compensation: 120,000 to 150,000 PHP per month depending on experience, plus performance bonuses

• Location: Fully remote

• Schedule: Monday to Friday, starting at 2:00 PM PH time

• Employment Type: Full-time

• Pay Frequency: Monthly

No negative environment — we build together



Hiring Process

Trial Simulation (Editing Task)

Interview

Onboarding & Probation (2 Months)

6-Month Contract Offered After Successful Probation



Why Join Us?

Stable monthly income

Long-term opportunity

Skill development in viral content editing

Clear path to higher pay and leadership

Structured, growth-focused agency

Be part of a team building real online personal brands



If you are serious about improving your editing skills, working consistently, and growing long-term with a team — we would love to hear from you.

title: Professional Video Editor for E-commerce Brands
description:
We are hiring a FULL-TIME (40 hours per week, 5 days a week) highly skilled Video Editor to join our fast-growing Shopify e-commerce team. This is not a casual freelance position. We are looking for a serious performance editor who understands direct-response marketing and knows how to create video ads that convert impulsive buyers into immediate customers. If you only focus on making aesthetic edits without understanding conversion psychology, this role is not for you.



Our brand relies heavily on powerful, scroll-stopping creatives that drive purchases. Your primary responsibility will be producing high-converting video ads for platforms such as Meta and TikTok. You must be capable of delivering 4–6 high-quality video ads per day, ranging from 30 seconds to 2 minutes, while maintaining strong performance standards. Speed matters, but quality and conversion performance matter more.



You will be responsible for editing UGC-style ads, product demonstrations, problem-solution creatives, competitor-style variations, and scaling ads. You must be able to combine footage from multiple sources seamlessly, source B-roll using our established systems (even when raw content is limited), structure strong 3-second hooks, build emotional engagement, optimize pacing for retention, and add captions, sound design, and motion graphics that increase watch time and conversion rate.



You must be highly proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro. Experience with After Effects, CapCut Pro, Runway ML, Pika, Descript, and other AI-based editing tools is strongly preferred. You must be comfortable using AI tools in your workflow, including voice cloning and AI voiceovers with ElevenLabs. You should understand how to enhance ad quality using AI without making it look artificial or overproduced.



Additional responsibilities include accurate labeling and organization of all video ads, working within 
 for structured reviews and feedback, collaborating through Miro boards for creative planning and ad structuring, revising creatives quickly based on feedback, following detailed instructions precisely, and collaborating effectively with the team. You must be able to take a blueprint and not only execute it correctly but elevate it. We are not looking for someone who follows instructions mechanically. We want someone who understands the structure and masters it.



Requirements include strong proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, proven experience in e-commerce video editing with a deep understanding of direct-response marketing, strong storytelling and pacing skills, branding awareness, the ability to work quickly and efficiently under tight deadlines, and full reliability for a consistent 40-hour work week schedule. You must think like a marketer, not just an editor. You should understand impulsive buying psychology, hook rate, CTR, retention, and conversion rate. Metrics matter in this role.



Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a paid test edit based on a blueprint we provide. You will also participate in a one-week paid trial period to demonstrate your ability to meet performance and volume expectations. This process is designed to filter for high-level talent only.



This is a long-term position with consistent workload and growth opportunities inside a fast-paced, performance-driven environment.



To apply, submit your portfolio showcasing your best-performing e-commerce video ads, a Loom video introducing yourself and explaining why we should hire you along with your expertise in video editing, your WhatsApp contact information for communication, confirmation of your availability for full-time work (40 hours per week), and include “MIDNIGHT” in your
 subject line. Failure to follow these instructions will result in automatic disqualification.



If you are not confident in your ability to produce conversion-driven creatives at scale, do not apply. We are building a serious brand and we are hiring accordingly.

title: Remote Graphic Artist/Illustrator
description:
Location: Remote  

Type: Full-Time Contract 

Salary: $1,050/month 

Working Hours: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST 





We’re looking for a skilled Remote Graphic Artist to join our creative team full-time on a contract basis. This role is primarily focused on graphic design, illustration, and print-ready artwork, with a smaller portion of the work involving 3D STL design for collectible and commemorative coins. 



While most responsibilities center around 2D design, working knowledge of 3D design is required. The artist will occasionally assist with converting artwork into 3D STL reliefs for coin production. Prior experience with coin engraving is not required — engraving limitations and production constraints will be learned on the job. 



Adobe illustrator and Photoshop skills are necessity



Why Join Us? 



Competitive Pay: $1,050/month 



Stable Full-Time Role: Long-term remote contractor position 



Creative Variety: Graphic design, illustration, and collectible coin projects 



Clear Structure: Consistent EST working hours and organized workflows 



Responsibilities 



Create high-quality vector graphics and illustrations using Adobe Illustrator 



Edit and enhance designs using Adobe Photoshop 



Prepare print-ready artwork, including layouts and die lines when required 



Design artwork for collectible and commemorative coins 



Convert 2D artwork into basic 3D STL reliefs suitable for production 



Collaborate with the team to meet brand, quality, and deadline requirements 



Manage multiple projects with strong attention to detail 



Requirements 



Strong proficiency in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop 



Experience with print layout, illustration, or packaging design 



Working knowledge of 3D design and STL file creation 



Familiarity with at least one 3D software tool (e.g., Blender, ZBrush, Rhino, Fusion 360, or similar) 



Ability to work independently in a remote environment and communicate clearly 



Strong organizational skills and time management 



Portfolio Requirement 



Applicants must submit a portfolio that includes: 



Examples of 2D graphic design or illustration work 



At least one example of 3D work (STL files, reliefs, models, or rendered screenshots) 



An editing/design test will be part of the screening process. 



How to Apply 



Submit your application along with your portfolio showcasing your best work.

title: YouTube Shorts Editor
description:
We’re looking for a creative YouTube Shorts editor who understands attention — not just effects.

Your mission: turn our long-form YouTube videos into short, punchy, story-driven clips that make people stop scrolling and start watching.



Before we talk editing, we want to see how you think.



---



Step 1: The Hook Test



We’ll send you a 5-minute YouTube video.



Your first task:

Identify 5 strong hooks (5–10 seconds each) that could become great Shorts.



Each hook should:

• Grab attention in the first 3 seconds

• Tease a result, transformation, or bold insight

• Make the viewer curious to see what comes next



Examples:



“This $10 AI website makes $1,000 a month.”

“Everyone’s doing SEO wrong — here’s the fix.”

“I built 3 tiny websites that print money while I sleep.”



If your hooks are strong, you’ll move to a paid trial cutting Shorts from our raw videos.



---



About Us



We run a fast-growing YouTube channel and education platform that helps creators and entrepreneurs use AI, SEO, and automation to build scalable, semi-passive income systems.



We also run a private community and online academy where we teach these frameworks in detail.

We post 5–7 long-form videos per week and are looking to repurpose these videos to 5-10 shorts each.



Our tone is:

Honest, direct, no fluff — a mix of creative builder energy and analytical depth.



We show what’s working, what’s not, and how people can build online systems that actually make money.



---



Our Audience



Our viewers are:

• Independent creators, solopreneurs, and small agency owners

• People who love building things — websites, automations, workflows

• Smart, curious, time-poor — they want clarity, not hype

• Interested in AI tools, automation, and marketing, but allergic to corporate jargon



They’re the kind of person who hears “I built 5 AI websites that earn while I sleep” and instantly thinks,



“Show me how you did that.”



---



You’re a Good Fit If

• You understand YouTube pacing (1 cut every 1–2 seconds)

• You’ve edited for YouTube, Reels, or TikTok before

• You can find the story in a clip — not just trim footage

• You care about hooks, retention, and emotion

• You’re fluent in English and reliable



---



Editing Style We’re After



We value:

• Strong hooks (0–3s) — scroll-stopping cold opens

• Fast pacing (3–12s) — every line matters

• Visual variety — punch-ins, overlays, relevant B-roll

• Kinetic captions — highlight emotion, surprise, or numbers (“$1,000s”, “stupid simple”)

• Natural loops / curiosity endings — “Wait till you see what happens next…”



We don’t need flashy transitions or heavy effects.

Clean, story-first edits is what we're after.



---



Compensation

• Hook Test: unpaid (takes 10–15 minutes)

• Paid Trial: $25 total for 5 Shorts

• Ongoing Work: 50–100 Shorts per week, approximately 8 per week - paid hourly at $5–10 per hour based on quality of work

• Top Performers: move to a $1,000–1,600 per month retainer for full-time output



---



How to Apply



Send:

1. A short intro (1–2 sentences about your editing background)

2. Links to 2–3 Shorts or TikToks you’ve edited

3. Your 5 hooks from our test video (we’ll send it after you apply)



Use the subject line: “Hooks First”.

title: After-Hours + Weekend Customer Service VA (Calls + Texts) – US Home Services
description:
We are a fast-growing US home services company (Permanent Lighting, Holiday Lighting, and Exterior Cleaning).



We are hiring a reliable After-Hours + Weekend Customer Service VA to handle incoming calls, texts, and messages when our office is closed.



This role is extremely important. You will be the first point of contact for customers.



You must be confident on the phone and comfortable speaking with US customers.



Responsibilities



• Answer inbound calls after-hours and on weekends (US Eastern Time)

• Return missed calls within 5 minutes

• Respond quickly to texts, voi
s,
, and website inquiries

• Schedule estimates and appointments inside our CRM

• Send confirmations and reminders

• Provide general pricing ranges (no guessing or making promises)

• Document all conversations accurately

• Escalate urgent issues when necessary



Schedule



• Nights and weekends (US Eastern Time)

• Approximately 36 hours per week

• Exact shift schedule will be discussed during interview



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



• Excellent spoken English (clear, neutral accent)

• Confident phone voice (must be comfortable talking to customers)

• Customer service experience (US clients preferred)

• Very reliable and organized

• Fast response time

• Must have backup power

• Must have backup internet

• Must have backup mobile service

• Quiet home workspace

• USB headset



If you do not have backup power and backup internet, please do not apply.



Pay



$7 per hour to start

Opportunity for raise after 30 days based on performance



IMPORTANT – How to Apply



To prove you read this post, start your application with the word:



TIDEWATER



Then submit:



Resume



Internet speed test screenshot



Photos of your backup power and backup internet setup



A 2–3 minute Loom video answering these questions:



Your name and location



Your experience answering calls for US customers



Why you are a good fit for this role



Your backup power and backup internet plan



What you would do if you missed a customer call



What you would say to an angry customer



Speak naturally. Do not read a script.

title: Experienced Customer Service Specialist (Dropshipping)
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce brand selling high-demand supplement and beauty products to the United States market. We drive traffic primarily through
 Ads and operate on a dropshipping model with fulfillment from China.



We are looking for a savvy, "A-player" Customer Service Representative who understands the reality of dropshipping and knows how to keep customers happy even when shipping takes time. You are not just answering
s; you are the front line of defense against chargebacks and the voice of our brand.



We need someone with high initiative who can de-escalate angry customers and manage expectations professionally.



Key Responsibilities

* Ticket Management: Respond to all customer inquiries within 24 hours. You must clear the queue daily during your shift.

* Order Tracking Support: Proactively handle "Where is my order?" (WISMO) inquiries. Since we ship from China with limited tracking updates, you must be skilled at reassuring customers and explaining shipping timelines (2-4 weeks) without causing alarm.

* Chargeback Prevention: Identify at-risk customers and resolve their issues before they file a dispute. You will be responsible for keeping our chargeback rate low by offering creative solutions (refunds, reshipments, or appeasements) based on our SOPs.

* Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot delivery issues and product questions for US-based customers with perfect English grammar and tone.



What We Are Looking For

* Dropshipping Experience is a MUST: You must have proven experience working with dropshipping stores (Shopify). You understand the logistics of shipping from China to the US.

* Chargeback Savvy: You understand what a dispute/chargeback is and have strategies to prevent them.

* Communication Skills: Native-level written English. You must be able to sound empathetic, professional, and firm when necessary.

* High Initiative: We do not want to micromanage you. If you see a problem (e.g., a tracking number isn't updating for 10 days), you investigate it before the customer complains.

* Tech Savvy: Comfortable using Shopify and Google Workspace, USPS and ParcelWill software 

Work Schedule & Compensation

* Pay: Up to $5 USD per hour (paid bi-weekly or monthly via) 

* Hours: 4 hours per day (20 hours per week).

* Flexibility: While the hours are flexible, you must ensure all tickets are responded to within the 24-hour service level agreement (SLA).



How to Apply Please apply with the subject line "Dropshipping CS Expert - [Your Name]" and include:

1. A brief summary of your experience with dropshipping stores.

2. Your expected start date (we are looking to hire immediately!).

description:
Bristow & Hardy

Remote (Philippines)

Full time



The role in one sentence



You will write
 sequences and build HTML
s for recruitment agency clients to help them get replies, meetings, and new business.



Why we are hiring



 is one of the most important services we deliver. Our clients rely on us to create
s that feel human, sound credible, and lead to conversations. We need someone who can take ownership of

Who this role is for



This role is for someone based in the Philippines who is confident working remotely with a UK team and UK based clients. You should be comfortable working to deadlines, following briefs, and communicating clearly online.

You learn our approach, tone, and workflow

You deliver your first sequences and HTML
s to a high standard

Within 90 days

You build HTML
s quickly and they display properly on desktop and mobile

You reduce mistakes by doing strong checks before anything goes to a client



Within 6 to 12 months



You help improve results by learning what works and applying it

You build templates and repeatable processes to speed up delivery

You contribute ideas for new campaigns, lead magnets, and nurture journeys



What you will do

Write
 sequences



You will write B2B
 sequences, usually 8 to 12
s

You will adapt messaging for different recruitment markets

You will keep writing clear and focused with a simple call to action



Build HTML
s



You will build clean HTML
s using templates

You will adjust layout, spacing, and structure so
s are easy to read

You will make sure
s look good in Gmail and Outlook and on mobile

You will check links and personalisation fields



Quality checks



You will proofread and test
s before they go out

You will spot errors early and fix them

You will keep work consistent across different clients



Improve performance



You will look at what worked and what did not

You will suggest improvements to subject lines, structure, and messaging

You will help clients get better outcomes over time



You will be a good fit if



You can write short, clear B2B
s that get replies

You can manage deadlines across multiple clients

You can work independently and take ownership

You communicate clearly and respond reliably during working hours



Essential skills



Strong writing skills, especially for

Experience writing or editing B2B
 sequences

Experience building HTML
s in tools like HubSpot, Mailchimp, or Brevo

Strong proofreading and quality control

Comfortable working in a fast moving agency



Nice to have



Experience in recruitment or working with recruitment clients

Basic deliverability knowledge

Experience with testing, segmentation, or automation workflows



What you get at Bristow & Hardy



You work in a specialist agency that only serves recruitment agencies

You get ownership and trust

You will improve quickly because
 is a core focus here

You will help shape how we deliver
 as we grow through 2026



How to apply



Send your CV and one of the following

Two or three examples of sequences you have written

A short note explaining how you write a sequence that gets replies

If you have built HTML
s before, include screenshots or examples

title: Full-Time Video Editor (Online Education + YouTube + Social Media)
description:
About the Role



We are hiring a skilled Video Editor to help complete the remaining videos for a high-level online course hosted on Skool.



This is a priority project over the next several weeks, with consistent work available immediately. After the course videos are completed, the role will continue into long-term editing for YouTube and social media content.



We are building a serious educational brand in the entrepreneurship and e-commerce space. We need a professional editor who understands pacing, clarity, and clean educational content, not flashy gaming-style edits.



?



What You’ll Be Working On



Phase 1 (Immediate Priority):

 • Editing structured online course videos

 • Cleaning up long-form recordings

 • Adding light motion graphics, titles, overlays

 • Removing mistakes, pauses, filler words where appropriate

 • Improving audio quality

 • Exporting in clean, organized formats



Phase 2 (Ongoing Work):

 • YouTube long-form videos

 • Short-form Reels, Shorts, TikToks

 • Repurposed content from calls and recordings

 • Thumbnails coordination (optional but a plus)



?



Required Experience



You must have experience editing with professional software, such as:

 • Adobe Premiere Pro

 • Final Cut Pro

 • CapCut (Pro level)

 • DaVinci Resolve



You must:

 • Understand pacing for educational content

 • Know how to use lower thirds, transitions, clean cuts

 • Be comfortable with basic color correction

 • Be comfortable improving audio quality

 • Be able to follow revision feedback carefully



?



This Role Is NOT For You If

 • You only edit gaming videos or 
 content

 • You rely only on templates

 • You cannot handle revisions professionally

 • You disappear or communicate inconsistently

 • You are juggling many freelance clients



We are looking for someone reliable, detail-oriented, and professional.



?



Availability Requirements

 • Must be available consistently over the next several weeks

 • Must respond to messages within 24 hours

 • Must be comfortable with revision cycles

 • Must be able to handle structured deadlines



This is not one small project. We are building long-term.



?



Portfolio Requirements (Very Important)



You must provide:

 • A portfolio link

 • At least 2 examples of educational or business content creators

 • Long-form content examples preferred

 • Short-form examples are a bonus



Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



?



Work Schedule

 • Full-time preferred during course completion

 • 30 to 40 hours per week

 • Flexible hours, but consistent communication required



?



Pay Range (PH Market)

 • PHP 45,000 to 75,000 per month

 • Based on experience and skill level

 • Performance-based increases available



?



Application Instructions



Put "Hey Dave, hire me as your video editor!" in your application subject line so we know you read everything.



Please answer the following:

 1. What software do you primarily use and how long have you used it?

 2. Have you edited online course content before?

 3. How do you approach editing educational videos differently from entertainment videos?

 4. Provide 2 to 4 portfolio links.

 5. Are you available full-time for the next 4 to 6 weeks?

title: PPC & SEO Manager
description:
Department: PPC & SEO



Location: Remote (Work From Home)



Business Marketing Engine (BME) is looking for a highly skilled PPC & SEO Manager to lead our growing Paid Media and Search Optimization Team. This role is ideal for someone who is both strategic and hands-on, with strong leadership abilities and deep experience managing PPC and SEO efforts across multiple clients and platforms.

If you’re passionate about driving results, building efficient systems, and developing high-performing teams, we’d love to hear from you!



About the Role



As the PPC & SEO Team Lead, you will oversee the strategy, execution, optimization, and performance of paid media and SEO campaigns for BME clients. You’ll manage a team of specialists, ensure deadlines are met, maintain streamlined workflows, and guide the department toward achieving measurable growth.



You will also support campaign execution directly as needed and ensure that every client’s marketing engine is performing at its highest level.



Key ResponsibilitiesPPC & SEO Team Lead

Manage and support the PPC & SEO Team to ensure effectiveness and growth.

Coordinate with internal teams and resources to ensure campaign success.

Train, mentor, and support tea
mbers and other BME departments.

Develop strategies for PPC, SEO, and additional lead-generation campaigns.

Review and analyze campaign performance regularly; provide optimization guidance.

Continuously research and implement improved processes and best practices.

Oversee project timelines, task management, and deliverables in 
.

Create and update SOPs and workflows to improve efficiency.

Support PMs with underperforming campaigns.

Guide market research efforts and ensure campaigns hit performance benchmarks.

Assist with any needs essential to BME’s success.

PPC Specialist Duties (as part of the role)

Communicate with clients and internal teams.

Set up and manage ad accounts (Google,
, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.).

Define goals and launch campaigns aligned with client objectives.

Perform A/B testing on ads and landing pages.

Monitor key performance metrics and optimize campaigns.

Provide weekly, monthly, and annual campaign reports.

Stay updated on platform changes and industry trends.

Proactively identify opportunities to improve performance.



PPC & SEO Team Lead

Strong client relationships built through clear and proactive communication.

On-time delivery of project assets and campaign updates.

Organized documentation and streamlined workflows.

A high-performing Lead Engine department with consistent improvements.

Ongoing growth and development of tea
mbers.



PPC Specialist

Accurate, timely reporting and insights.

Clear communication with internal teams for smooth collaboration.

Well-managed, high-performing, and fully optimized campaigns.



PPC & SEO Team Lead Requirements

Strong leadership and communication skills.

Excellent collaboration and negotiation abilities.

Advanced time management, planning, and forecasting skills.

Strong problem-solving and adaptability.

Experience with task management and project oversight.

Ability to facilitate meetings and manage risks.

Tech-savvy and comfortable with digital tools.

PPC Specialist Requirements

Proficiency in major PPC platforms (Google, Meta, LinkedIn, YouTube).

Understanding of keyword research and analytics tools.

Knowledge of landing page best practices.

Strong analytical skills and creative problem-solving.

Proficiency with Google Sheets / Excel.

Ability to manage multiple campaigns efficiently.

Willingness to learn new tools and platforms.

Strong collaboration and communication skills.



Job Specifications

Fully remote position

Must have:

Reliable internet + backup connection

Backup power source

Fast and reliable computer

Must commit to ongoing learning and professional growth

Must be adaptable and able to support business needs as required





Fill out this application to be considered:
